18.37: I pursued my enemies and overtook them; I did not turn around until they were utterly defeated.
18.38: I struck them down, so they are not able to rise up; they fell under my feet.
18.39: You clothed me with strength for war; you will subdue under me those who rise up against me.
18.40: You have made my enemies turn their back to me, and I will destroy those who hate me.
18.41: They cried out for deliverance, but there was no one to deliver; they cried out to the LORD, but he did not answer them.
18.42: I ground them like wind-swept dust; I emptied them out like dirt in the street.
18.43: You rescued me from conflict with the people; you made me head of the nations. People who did not know me will serve me.
18.44: When they hear of me, they will obey me; foreigners will submit to me.
18.45: Foreigners will wilt away; they will come trembling out of their stronghold.
18.46: The LORD lives! Blessed be my Rock! May the God of my deliverance be exalted!
18.47: He is the God who executes vengeance on my behalf; who destroys peoples under me;
18.48: who delivers me from my enemies. Truly you will exalt me above those who oppose me; you will deliver me from the violent person.
18.49: Therefore, I will give thanks to you among the nations, LORD; I will sing praises to your name.
18.50: He is the one who gives victories to his king; who shows gracious love to his anointed, to David and his seed forever.

19.1: The heavens are declaring the glory of God, and their expanse shows the work of his hands.
19.2: Day after day they pour forth speech, night after night they reveal knowledge.
19.3: There is no speech nor are there words— their voice is not heard—
19.4: yet their message goes out into all the world, and their words to the ends of the earth. He has set up a tent for the sun in the heavens,
19.5: which is like a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, or like a champion who rejoices at the beginning of a race.
19.6: Its circuit is from one end of the sky to the other, and nothing is hidden from its heat.
19.7: The Law of the LORD is perfect, restoring life. The testimony of the LORD is steadfast, making foolish people wise.
19.8: The precepts of the LORD are upright, making the heart rejoice. The commandment of the LORD is pure, giving light to the eyes.
19.9: The fear of the LORD is clean, standing forever. The judgments of the LORD are true; they are altogether righteous.
19.10: They are more desirable than gold, even much fine gold. They are sweeter than honey, even the drippings from a honeycomb.
19.11: Moreover your servant is warned by them; and there is great reward in keeping them.
19.12: Who can detect his own mistake? Cleanse me from hidden sin.
19.13: Preserve your servant from arrogant people; do not let them rule over me. Then I will be upright and acquitted of great wickedness.
19.14: May the words of my mouth and the meditations of my heart be acceptable in your sight, LORD, my Rock and my Redeemer.

20.1: May the LORD answer you in the day of distress; may the name of the God of Jacob protect you.
20.2: May he send you help from the sanctuary, and may he sustain you from Zion.
20.3: May he remember all your gifts, and may he accept your burnt offerings. Interlude
20.4: May he give you what your heart desires, and may he fulfill all your plans.
20.5: May we shout for joy at your deliverance and unfurl our banners in the name of our God. May the LORD fulfill all your petitions.
20.6: Now I know that the LORD has delivered his anointed; he has answered him from his sanctuary with the strength of his right hand of deliverance.
20.7: Some boast in chariots, others in horses; but we will boast in the name of the LORD our God.
20.8: While they bowed down and fell, we arose and stood upright.
20.9: Deliver us, LORD! Answer us, our King, on the day we cry out!

21.1: The king rejoices in your strength, LORD. How greatly he rejoices in your deliverance.
21.2: You have granted him the desire of his heart, and have not withheld what his lips requested. Interlude
21.3: You go before him with wonderful blessings, and put a crown of fine gold on his head.
21.4: He asked life from you, and you gave it to him— a long life for ever and ever.
21.5: His glory is great because of your deliverance, you have given him honor and majesty.
21.6: Indeed, you have given him eternal blessings; you will make him glad with the joy of your presence.
21.7: The king trusts in the LORD; because of the gracious love of the Most High, he will stand firm.
21.8: Your hand will find all your enemies, your right hand will find those who hate you.
21.9: When you appear, you will set them ablaze like a fire furnace. In his wrath, the LORD will consume them, and the fire will devour them.
21.10: You will destroy their descendants from the earth, even their offspring from the ranks of mankind.
21.11: Though they plot evil against you and devise schemes, they will not succeed.
21.12: Indeed, you will make them retreat, when you aim your bow at their faces.
21.13: Rise up, LORD, because you are strong; we will sing and praise your power.

22.1: My God! My God! Why have you abandoned me? Why are you so far from delivering me— from my groaning words?
22.2: My God, I cry out to you throughout the day, but you do not answer; and throughout the night, but I have no rest.
22.3: You are holy, enthroned on the praises of Israel.
22.4: Our ancestors trusted in you; they trusted and you delivered them.
22.5: They cried out to you and escaped; they trusted in you and were not put to shame.
22.6: But as for me, I am only a worm and not a man, scorned by mankind and despised by people.
22.7: Everyone who sees me mocks me; they gape at me with open mouths and shake their heads at me.
22.8: They say, "Commit yourself to the LORD; perhaps the LORD will deliver him, perhaps he will cause him to escape, since he delights in him."
22.9: Yet, you are the one who took me from the womb, and kept me safe on my mother's breasts.
22.10: I was dependent on you from birth; from my mother's womb you have been my God.
22.11: Do not be so distant from me, for trouble is at hand; indeed, there is no deliverer.
22.12: Many bulls have surrounded me; the vicious bulls of Bashan have encircled me.
22.13: Their mouths are opened wide toward me, like roaring and attacking lions.
22.14: I am poured out like water; all my bones are out of joint. My heart is like wax, melting within me.
22.15: My strength is dried up like broken pottery; my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth, and you have brought me down to the dust of death.
22.16: For dogs have surrounded me; a gang of those who practice of evil has encircled me. They gouged my hands and my feet.
22.17: I can count all my bones. They look at me; they stare at me.
22.18: They divide my clothing among themselves; they cast lots for my clothing!
22.19: But as for you, LORD, do not be far away from me; My Strength, come quickly to help me.
22.20: Deliver me from the sword; my precious life from the power of the dog.
22.21: Deliver me from the mouth of the lion, from the horns of the wild oxen. You have answered me.
22.22: I will declare your name to my brothers; in the midst of the congregation, I will praise you, saying,
22.23: "All who fear the LORD, praise him! All the seed of Jacob, glorify him! All the seed of Israel, fear him!
22.24: For he does not despise nor detest the afflicted person; he does not hide his face from him, but he hears him when he cries out to him."
22.25: My praise in the great congregation is because of you; I will pay my vows before those who fear you.
22.26: The afflicted will eat and be satisfied; those who seek the LORD will praise him, "May you live forever!"
22.27: All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the LORD; all the families of the nations will bow in submission to the LORD.
22.28: Indeed, the kingdom belongs to the LORD; he rules over the nations.
22.29: All the prosperous people will eat and bow down in submission. All those who are about to go down to the grave will bow down in submission, along with the one who can no longer keep himself alive.
22.30: Our descendants will serve him, and that generation will be told about the Lord.
22.31: They will come and declare his righteousness to a people yet to be born; indeed, he has accomplished it!

23.1: The LORD is the one who is shepherding me; I lack nothing.
23.2: He causes me to lie down in pastures of green grass; he guides me beside quiet waters.
23.3: He revives my life; he leads me in pathways that are righteous for the sake of his name.
23.4: Even when I walk through a valley of deep darkness, I will not be afraid because you are with me. Your rod and your staff—they comfort me.
23.5: You prepare a table before me, even in the presence of my enemies. You anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows.
23.6: Truly, goodness and gracious love will pursue me all the days of my life, and I will remain in the LORD's Temple forever.

24.1: The earth and everything in it exists for the LORD— the world and those who live in it.
24.2: Indeed, he founded it upon the seas, he established it upon deep waters.
24.3: Who may ascend the mountain of the LORD? Who may stand in his Holy Place?
24.4: The one who has innocent hands and a pure heart; the person who does not delight in what is false and does not swear an oath deceitfully.
24.5: This person will receive blessing from the LORD and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
24.6: This is the generation that seeks him. Those who seek your face are the true seed of Jacob. Interlude
24.7: Lift up your heads, gates! Be lifted up, ancient doors, so the King of Glory may come in.
24.8: Who is the King of Glory? The LORD strong and mighty, the LORD, mighty in battle.
24.9: Lift up your heads, gates! Be lifted up, ancient doors, so the King of Glory may come in.
24.10: Who is he, this King of Glory? The LORD of the heavenly armies— He is the King of Glory. Interlude

25.1: I will lift up my soul to you, LORD.
25.2: I trust in you, my God, do not let me be ashamed; do not let my enemies triumph over me.
25.3: Indeed, no one who waits on you will be ashamed, but those who offend for no reason will be put to shame.
25.4: Cause me to understand your ways, LORD; teach me your paths.
25.5: Guide me in your truth and teach me; for you are the God who delivers me. All day long I have waited for you.
25.6: Remember, LORD, your tender mercies and your gracious love; indeed, they are eternal!
25.7: Do not remember my youthful sins and transgressions; but remember me in light of your gracious love, in light of your goodness, LORD.
25.8: The LORD is good and just; therefore he will teach sinners concerning the way.
25.9: He will guide the humble to justice; he will teach the humble his way.
25.10: All the paths of the LORD lead to gracious love and truth for those who keep his covenant and his decrees.
25.11: For the sake of your name, LORD, forgive my sin, for it is great.
25.12: Who is the man who fears the LORD? God will teach him the path he should choose.
25.13: He will experience good things; his descendants will inherit the earth.
25.14: The intimate counsel of the LORD is for those who fear him so they may know his covenant.
25.15: My eyes look to the LORD continuously, because he's the one who releases my feet from the trap.
25.16: Turn toward me and have mercy on me, for I am lonely and oppressed.
25.17: The troubles of my heart have increased; bring me out of my distress!
25.18: Look upon my distress and affliction; forgive all my sins.
25.19: Look how many enemies I have gained! They hate me with a vicious hatred.
25.20: Preserve my life and deliver me; do not let me be ashamed, because I take refuge in you.
25.21: Integrity and justice will preserve me, because I wait on you.
25.22: Redeem Israel, God, from all its troubles.

26.1: Vindicate me, LORD, because I have walked in integrity; I have trusted in the LORD without wavering.
26.2: Examine me, LORD, and inspect me! Test my heart and mind.
26.3: For your gracious love precedes me, and I continuously walk according to your truth.
26.4: I do not sit with those committed to what is false, nor do I travel with hypocrites.
26.5: I hate the company of those who practice evil, nor do I sit with the wicked.
26.6: I wash my hands innocently. I go around your altar, LORD,
26.7: so I may praise you loudly with thanksgiving and declare all your wondrous acts.
26.8: LORD, I love the dwelling place that is your house, the place where your glory resides.
26.9: Do not group me with sinners, nor include me with men who shed blood.
26.10: Their hands are filled with wicked schemes, and their right hands with bribes.
26.11: But as for me, I walk in my integrity. Redeem me and be gracious to me!
26.12: My feet stand on level ground; among the worshiping congregations I will bless the LORD.

27.1: The LORD is my light and my salvation— whom will I fear? The LORD is the strength of my life; of whom will I be afraid?
27.2: When those who practice evil, my enemies, and my oppressors come near me to devour my flesh, they stumble and fall.
27.3: If an army encamps against me, my heart will not fear. If a war is launched against me, I will even trust in that situation.
27.4: I have asked one thing from the LORD; it is what I really seek: that I may remain in the LORD's Temple all the days of my life, to gaze on the beauty of the LORD; and to inquire in his Temple.
27.5: For he will conceal me in his shelter on the day of evil; He will hide me in a secluded chamber within his tent; He will place me on a high rock.
27.6: Now my head will be lifted up above my enemies, even those who surround me. I will sacrifice in his tent with shouts of joy; I will sing and make melodies to the LORD.
27.7: Hear my voice, LORD, when I cry out! Be gracious to me and answer me.
27.8: My mind recalls your word, "Seek my face," so your face, LORD, I will seek.
27.9: Do not hide your face from me; do not turn away in anger from your servant. You have been my help, therefore do not abandon or forsake me, God of my salvation.
27.10: Though my father and my mother abandoned me, the LORD gathers me up.
27.11: Teach me your way, LORD, and lead me on a level path because of my enemies.
27.12: Do not hand me over to the desires of my enemies; for false witnesses have risen up against me; even the one who breathes out violence.
27.13: I believe that I will see the LORD's goodness in the land of the living.
27.14: Wait on the LORD. Be courageous, and he will strengthen your heart. Wait on the LORD!

28.1: To you, LORD, I cry out! My Rock, do not refuse to answer me. If you remain silent, I will become like those who descend into the Pit.
28.2: Hear the sound of my supplications when I cry to you for help, as I lift up my hands toward your most holy sanctuary.
28.3: Do not drag me away with the wicked, with those who practice iniquity, who speak peace to their neighbors while harboring evil in their hearts.
28.4: Reward them according to their deeds; according to the evil of their actions. Reward them based on what they do; give them what they deserve.
28.5: Because they do not understand the deeds of the LORD or the work of his hands, He will tear them down and never build them up.
28.6: Blessed be the LORD! For he has heard the sound of my supplications.
28.7: The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in him, and I received help. My heart rejoices, and I give thanks to him with my song.
28.8: The LORD is the strength of his people; he is a refuge of deliverance for his anointed.
28.9: Deliver your people and bless your inheritance! Shepherd them and lift them up forever!

29.1: Ascribe to the LORD, you heavenly beings; ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
29.2: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due his name; worship the LORD wearing holy attire.
29.3: The voice of the LORD was heard above the waters; the God of glory thundered; the LORD was heard over many waters.
29.4: The voice of the LORD is powerful; the voice of the LORD is majestic.
29.5: The voice of the LORD snaps the cedars; the LORD snaps the cedars of Lebanon.
29.6: He makes them stagger like a calf, even Lebanon and Sirion like a young wild ox.
29.7: The voice of the LORD shoots out flashes of fire.
29.8: The voice of the LORD shakes the wilderness; the voice of the LORD shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
29.9: The voice of the LORD causes deer to give birth, and strips the forest bare. In his Temple all of them shout, "Glory!"
29.10: The LORD sat enthroned over the flood, and the LORD sits as king forever.
29.11: The LORD will give strength to his people; the LORD will bless his people with peace.

30.1: I exalt you, LORD, for you have lifted me up, and my enemies could not gloat over me.
30.2: LORD, my God! I cried out to you for help and you healed me.
30.3: LORD, you brought me from death; you kept me alive so that I did not descend into the Pit.
30.4: You, his godly ones, sing to the LORD, give thanks at the mention of his holiness.
30.5: For his wrath is only momentary; yet his favor is for a lifetime. Weeping may lodge for the night, but shouts of joy will come in the morning.
30.6: As for me, I said in my prosperity, "I will never be moved."
30.7: By your favor, LORD, you established me as a strong mountain; Then you hid your face, and I was dismayed.
30.8: I cried out to you, LORD, and I make supplication to the Lord:
30.9: "What profit is there in my death if I go down to the Pit? Can dust worship you? Can it proclaim your faithfulness?"
30.10: Hear me, LORD, and have mercy on me! LORD, help me!
30.11: You have turned my mourning into dancing; you took off my sackcloth and clothed me with a garment of joy,
30.12: so that I may sing praise to you and not remain silent. LORD, my God, I will give you thanks forever!

31.1: In you, LORD, I have taken refuge. Let me never be ashamed. Because you are righteous, deliver me!
31.2: Listen to me, and deliver me quickly. Become a rock of safety for me, a fortified citadel to deliver me;
31.3: For you are my rock and my fortress; for the sake of your name guide me and lead me.
31.4: Rescue me from the net that they concealed to trap me; for you are my strength.
31.5: Into your hands I commit my spirit; for you have redeemed me, LORD God of truth.
31.6: I despise those who trust vain idols; but I have trusted in the LORD.
31.7: I will rejoice and be glad in your gracious love, for you see my affliction and take note that my soul is distressed.
31.8: You have not delivered me into the hand of the enemy, but you have set my feet in a sturdy place.
31.9: Be gracious to me, LORD, for I am in distress. My eyes have been consumed by my grief along with my soul and my body.
31.10: My life is consumed by sorrow, my years with groaning. My strength has faltered because of my iniquity; my bones have been consumed.
31.11: I have become an object of reproach to all my enemies, especially to my neighbors. I have become an object of fear to my friends, and whoever sees me outside runs away from me.
31.12: Like a dead man, I am forgotten in their thoughts — like broken pottery.
31.13: I have heard the slander of many; it is like terror all around me, as they conspire together and plot to take my life.
31.14: But I trust in you, LORD. I say, "You are my God."
31.15: My times are in your hands. Deliver me from the hands of my enemies and from those who pursue me.
31.16: May your face shine on your servant; in your gracious love, deliver me.
31.17: Let me not be ashamed, LORD, for I have called upon you. Let the wicked be put to shame, let them be silent in the next life.
31.18: Let the lying lips be made still, especially those who speak arrogantly against the righteous with pride and contempt.
31.19: How great is your goodness that you have reserved for those who fear you, that you have set in place for those who take refuge in you, in the presence of the children of men.
31.20: You will hide them in the secret place of your presence, away from the conspiracies of men. You will hide them in your tent, away from their contentious tongues.
31.21: Blessed be the LORD! In a marvelous way he demonstrated his gracious love to me, when I was in a city under siege.
31.22: When I said in my panic, "I have been cut off in your sight," then you surely heard the voice of my prayer in my plea to you for help.
31.23: Love the LORD, all his godly ones! The LORD preserves the faithful and repays those who act with proud motives.
31.24: Be strong, and let your heart be courageous, all you who put your hope in the LORD.

32.1: How blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
32.2: How blessed is the person against whom the LORD does not charge iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
32.3: When I kept silent about my sin, my body wasted away by my groaning all day long.
32.4: For your hand was heavy upon me day and night; my strength was exhausted as in a summer drought. Interlude
32.5: My sin I acknowledged to you; my iniquity I did not hide. I said, "I will confess my transgressions to the LORD." And you forgave the guilt of my sin! Interlude
32.6: Therefore every godly person should pray to you at such a time. Surely a flood of great waters will not reach him.
32.7: You are my hiding place; you will deliver me from trouble and surround me with shouts of deliverance. Interlude
32.8: I will instruct you and teach you concerning the path you should walk; I will direct you with my eye.
32.9: Don't be like a horse or mule, without understanding. They are held in check by a bit and bridle in their mouths; otherwise they will not remain near you.
32.10: The wicked have many sorrows, but gracious love surrounds those who trust in the LORD.
32.11: Righteous ones, be glad in the LORD and rejoice! Shout for joy, all of you who are upright in heart!

33.1: Rejoice in the LORD, righteous ones; for the praise of the upright is beautiful.
33.2: With the lyre, give thanks to the LORD; with the ten stringed harp, play music to him;
33.3: with a new song, sing to him; with shouts of joy, play skillfully.
33.4: For the word of the LORD is upright; and all his works are done in faithfulness.
33.5: He loves righteousness and justice; the world is filled with the gracious love of the LORD.
33.6: By the word of the LORD the heavens were made; all the heavenly bodies by the breath of his mouth.
33.7: He gathered the oceans into a single place; he put the deep water into storehouses.
33.8: Let all the world fear the LORD; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him;
33.9: because he spoke and it came to be, because he commanded, it stood firm.
33.10: The LORD makes void the counsel of nations; he frustrates the plans of peoples.
33.11: But the LORD's counsel stands firm forever, the plans in his mind for all generations.
33.12: How blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD, the people he has chosen as his own inheritance.
33.13: When the LORD looks down from heaven, he observes every human being.
33.14: From his dwelling place, he looks down on all the inhabitants of the earth.
33.15: He formed the hearts of them all; he understands everything they do.
33.16: A king is not saved by a large army; a mighty soldier is not delivered by his great strength.
33.17: It is vain to trust in a horse for deliverance, even with its great strength, it cannot deliver.
33.18: Indeed, the LORD watches those who fear him; those who trust in his gracious love
33.19: to deliver them from death; to keep them alive in times of famine.
33.20: We wait on the LORD; he is our help and our shield.
33.21: Indeed, our heart will rejoice in him, because we have placed our trust in his holy name.
33.22: LORD, may your gracious love be upon us, even as we hope in you.

34.1: I will bless the LORD at all times; his praise will be in my mouth continuously.
34.2: My soul will glorify the LORD; the humble will hear about it and rejoice.
34.3: Magnify the LORD with me! Let us lift up his name together!
34.4: I sought the LORD and he answered me; he delivered me from all of my fears.
34.5: Look to him and be radiant; and you will not be ashamed.
34.6: This poor man cried out, and the LORD heard and delivered him from all of his distress.
34.7: The angel of the LORD surrounds those who fear him, and he delivers them.
34.8: Taste and see that the LORD is good! How blessed is the person who trusts in him!
34.9: Fear the LORD, you holy ones of his; for those who fear him lack nothing.
34.10: Young lions lack and go hungry, but those who seek the LORD will never lack any good thing.
34.11: Come, children, listen to me, and I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
34.12: Who among you desires life, and wants long life in order to see good?
34.13: Then keep your tongue from doing evil and your lips from spreading lies.
34.14: Avoid evil and do good! Seek peace and pursue it!
34.15: The LORD looks on the righteous, and he listens to their cries.
34.16: The face of the LORD is set against those who do evil, and he will remove people's recollection of them from the earth.
34.17: The LORD hears those who cry out, and he delivers them from all their distress.
34.18: The LORD is close to the brokenhearted, and he delivers those whose spirit has been crushed.
34.19: A righteous person will have many troubles, but the LORD will deliver him from them all.
34.20: God protects all his bones; not one of them will be broken.
34.21: Evil will kill the wicked; those who hate the righteous will be held guilty.
34.22: The LORD redeems the lives of his servants; and none of those who trust in him will be held guilty.

35.1: Argue my case, LORD, against those who argue against me. Fight against those who fight against me.
35.2: Take up the buckler and the shield, and rise up to help me.
35.3: Take out the spear and the ax to confront the one who pursues me; say to me, "I am your deliverer!"
35.4: Let those who seek my life be ashamed and disgraced; let those who plot evil against me be driven back and confounded.
35.5: Make them like the chaff before the wind, as the messenger of the LORD pushes them aside.
35.6: May their path be dark and slippery, as the messenger of the LORD tracks them down.
35.7: Without justification they laid a snare for me; without justification they dug a pit to trap me.
35.8: Let destruction come upon them unawares, and let the net that he hid catch him; let him fall into destruction.
35.9: My soul will rejoice in the LORD and be glad in his deliverance.
35.10: All my bones will say, "LORD, who is like you? Who delivers the weak from the one who is stronger than he, and the weak and the needy from the one who wants to rob him?"
35.11: False witnesses stepped forward and questioned me concerning things about which I knew nothing.
35.12: They paid me back evil for good; my soul mourns.
35.13: But when they were sick, I wore sackcloth, humbled myself with fasting, and prayed from my heart repeatedly for them.
35.14: I paced about as for my friend or my brother, and fell down mourning as one weeps for one's mother.
35.15: But when I stumbled, they rejoiced and gathered together. They gathered together against me— attackers whom I did not know. They tore me apart and would not stop.
35.16: Malicious mockers — they gnashed their teeth against me.
35.17: Lord, how long will you just watch? Rescue me from their destruction, my precious life from these young lions.
35.18: Then I will give you thanks in front of the great congregation; in the midst of the mighty throng I will praise you.
35.19: Do not let my deceitful enemies gloat over me, nor let those who hate me without justification mock me with their eyes.
35.20: For they do not speak peace; they devise clever lies against the peaceful people of the land.
35.21: They open their mouth wide against me, claiming, "Yes! Yes! We saw him do it with our own eyes!"
35.22: You see this, LORD, so do not be silent. Lord, do not be far from me!
35.23: Wake up! Arouse yourself to vindicate me and argue my case, my God and my Lord.
35.24: Judge me according to your righteousness, LORD my God! But do not let them gloat over me.
35.25: Don't let them say in their hearts, "Yes! We got what we wanted." Don't let them say, "We have swallowed him up."
35.26: Instead, let those who gloat over the evil directed against me be ashamed and confounded together; Let those who exalt themselves over me be clothed with shame and dishonor.
35.27: Let those who delight in my vindication shout for joy and rejoice! Let them continuously say, "Magnify the LORD, who delights in giving peace to his servant."
35.28: My tongue will declare your righteousness and praise you all day long.

36.1: An oracle that came to me about the transgressions of the wicked: There is no fear of God before his eyes.
36.2: He flatters himself too much to discover his transgression and hate it.
36.3: The words from his mouth are vain and deceptive. He has abandoned behaving wisely and doing good.
36.4: He devises iniquity on his bed and is determined to follow a path that is not good. He does not resist evil.
36.5: Your gracious love, LORD, reaches to the heavens; your truth extends to the skies.
36.6: Your righteousness is like the mountains of God; your justice is like the great depths of the sea. You deliver both people and animals, LORD.
36.7: How precious is your gracious love, God! The children of men take refuge in the shadow of your wings.
36.8: They are refreshed from the abundance of your house; You cause them to drink from the river of your pleasures.
36.9: For with you is a fountain of life, and in your light we will see light.
36.10: Send forth your gracious love to those who know you, and your righteousness to those who are upright in heart.
36.11: Do not let the foot of the proud crush me; and do not let the hand of the wicked dissuade me.
36.12: There, those who do evil have fallen; They have been thrown down, and they cannot get up.

37.1: Don't be angry because of those who do evil, do not be jealous because of those who commit iniquity.
37.2: Indeed, they soon will wither like grass, and like green herbs they will fade away.
37.3: Trust in the LORD and do good. Dwell in the land and feed on faithfulness.
37.4: Delight yourself in the LORD, and he will give you the desires of your heart.
37.5: Commit your way to the LORD; Trust him, and he will act.
37.6: He will bring forth your righteousness as a light, and your justice as the noonday sun.
37.7: Be silent in the LORD's presence and wait patiently for him. Don't be angry because of the one whose way prospers or the one who implements evil schemes.
37.8: Calm your anger and abandon wrath. Don't be angry— it only leads to evil.
37.9: Those who do evil will perish. But those who wait on the LORD will inherit the land.
37.10: Yet a little while longer, and the wicked will be no more. You will search for his place, but he will not be there.
37.11: The humble will inherit the land; they will take in abundant peace.
37.12: The wicked person plots against the righteous, and grinds his teeth at him.
37.13: But the Lord laughs at him because he sees that his day is coming!
37.14: The wicked take out a sword and bend the bow, to bring down the humble and the poor to slay those who are righteous in conduct.
37.15: But their sword will pierce their own heart, and their bows will be broken!
37.16: Better is the little that the righteous have than the abundance of many wicked people.
37.17: For the arms of the wicked will be broken, but the LORD upholds the righteous.
37.18: The LORD knows the day of the blameless, and their inheritance will last forever.
37.19: They will not experience shame in times of trouble; in times of famine they will have plenty.
37.20: Indeed, the wicked will perish. The LORD's enemies will be consumed like flowers in the fields. They will vanish like smoke.
37.21: The wicked borrow but never pay back; but the righteous are generous and give.
37.22: For those blessed by God will inherit the land, but those cursed by him will be cut off.
37.23: A man's steps are established by the LORD, and the LORD delights in his way.
37.24: Though he stumbles, he will not fall down flat, for the LORD will hold up his hand.
37.25: I once was young and now I am old, but I have not seen a righteous person forsaken or his descendants begging for bread.
37.26: Every day he is generous, lending freely, and his descendants are blessed.
37.27: Depart from evil, and do good, and you will live in the land forever.
37.28: Indeed, the LORD loves justice, and he will not abandon his godly ones. They are kept safe forever, but the lawless will be chased away, and the descendants of the wicked will be cut off.
37.29: The righteous will inherit the land, and they will dwell in it forever.
37.30: The mouth of the righteous one produces wisdom; his tongue speaks justice.
37.31: The instruction of his God is in his heart; his steps will not slip.
37.32: The wicked stalks the righteous person, seeking to kill him,
37.33: but the LORD will not let him fall into his hands. He will not be condemned when he is put on trial.
37.34: Wait on the LORD, Keep faithful to his way, and he will exalt you to possess the land. You will see the wicked cut off.
37.35: I once observed a wicked and oppressive person, flourishing like a green tree in native soil.
37.36: But then he passed away; in fact, he simply was not there. When I looked for him, he could not be found.
37.37: Observe the blameless! Take note of the upright! Indeed, the future of that man is peace.
37.38: Sinners will be destroyed together; the future of the wicked will be cut off.
37.39: But deliverance for the righteous one comes from the LORD; he is their strength in times of distress.
37.40: The LORD helps and delivers them; he will deliver them from the wicked, and he will save them because they have sought refuge in him.

38.1: LORD! Do not rebuke me in your anger; do not correct me in your wrath,
38.2: because your arrows have sunk deep into me, and your hand has come down hard on me.
38.3: My body is unhealthy due to your anger, and my bones have no rest due to my sin.
38.4: My iniquities loom over my head; like a cumbersome burden, they are too heavy for me.
38.5: My wounds have putrefied and festered because of my foolishness.
38.6: I am bent over and walk about greatly bowed down; all day long I go around mourning.
38.7: My insides are burning and my body is unhealthy.
38.8: I am weak and utterly crushed; I cry out in distress because of my heart's anguish.
38.9: Lord, all my longings are before you, and my groaning is not hidden from you.
38.10: My heart pounds, my strength fails me, even the gleam in my eye is gone.
38.11: As for my friends and my neighbors, they stand aloof from my distress; even my close relatives stand at a distance.
38.12: Those who seek my life lay snares for me; those who seek to do me harm brag all day long about their wicked planning.
38.13: I am like the deaf, who cannot hear, and like the mute, who cannot open his mouth.
38.14: Indeed, I have become like a man who hears nothing, and in whose mouth there is no rebuke.
38.15: Because I have placed my hope in you, LORD, you will answer, Lord, my God.
38.16: For I said, "Do not let them gloat over me, as they congratulate themselves when my foot slips."
38.17: Indeed, I am being set up for a fall, and I am continuously reminded of my pain.
38.18: I confess my iniquity, and my sin troubles me.
38.19: But my enemies are alive and well; those who hate me for no reason are numerous.
38.20: They reward my good with evil, opposing me because I seek to do good.
38.21: Don't forsake me, LORD. My God, do not be so distant from me.
38.22: Come quickly and help me, Lord, my deliverer.

39.1: I told myself, "I will keep watch over my tongue to keep from sinning. I will muzzle my mouth when the wicked are around."
39.2: I was as silent as a mute person; I said nothing, not even something good, and my distress deepened.
39.3: My heart within me became incensed; as I thought about it, the fire burned. Then I spoke out:
39.4: "LORD, let me know how my life ends, and the standard by which you will measure my days, whatever it is! Then I will know how transient my life is.
39.5: Look, you have made my life span fit in your hand; It is nothing compared to yours. Surely every person at their best is a puff of wind. Interlude
39.6: In fact, people walk around as shadows. Surely, they busy themselves for nothing, heaping up possessions but not knowing who will get them.
39.7: How long, LORD, will I wait expectantly? I have placed my hope in you.
39.8: Deliver me from all my transgressions, and do not let fools scorn me."
39.9: I remain silent; I do not open my mouth, for you are the one who acted.
39.10: Stop scourging me, since I have been crushed by your heavy hand.
39.11: You rebuke by chastening a man with the consequence of iniquities; you destroy what is attractive to him, as one would treat a moth. Indeed, every person is a puff of wind. Interlude
39.12: Hear my prayer, LORD, pay attention to my cry, and do not ignore my tears. I am an alien in your presence, a stranger just like my ancestors were.
39.13: Stop looking at me with chastisement, so I can smile again, before I depart and am no more.

40.1: I waited expectantly for the LORD, and he took notice of me and heard my cry.
40.2: He plucked me out of a pit of confusion, even out of the quicksand; he placed my feet on a rock and established my steps.
40.3: He put a new song in my mouth, praise to our God! Many will watch and be in awe, and they will place their trust in the LORD.
40.4: How blessed is that strong person who places his trust in the LORD, and who has not acknowledged the proud nor resorted to lies.
40.5: LORD, my God, You have done great things: marvelous works and your thoughts toward us. There is no one who compares to you! I will try to recite your actions, even though there are too many to number.
40.6: You take no delight in sacrifices and offerings— you have prepared my ears to listen— you require no burnt offerings or sacrifices for sin.
40.7: Then I said, "Here I am! I have come! In the scroll of the book it is written about me.
40.8: I delight to do your will, my God. Your Law is part of my inner being."
40.9: In the great congregation I have proclaimed the righteous good news. Behold, I did not seal my lips, LORD, as you know.
40.10: I have not ignored your righteousness in my heart; instead, I have proclaimed your faithfulness and deliverance. I have not concealed your gracious love and truthfulness from the great congregation.
40.11: LORD, do not withhold your mercy from me, for your gracious love and truthfulness will keep me safe continuously.
40.12: Innumerable evils have surrounded me; my iniquities have overtaken me so that I cannot see. They are more in number than the hair on my head, and my courage has forsaken me.
40.13: Be pleased, LORD, to deliver me; LORD, hurry up and help me!
40.14: May those who seek to destroy my life be ashamed and confounded; let them be driven backwards and humiliated, particularly those who wish me evil.
40.15: Let shame be the reward for those who say to me, "Aha! Aha!"
40.16: Let all who seek you shout for joy and be glad in you. May those who love your deliverance say, "The LORD be magnified!" continuously.
40.17: But I am poor and needy; may the Lord think about me. You are my help and deliverer. My God, do not tarry too long!

41.1: Blessed is the one who is considerate of the destitute; the LORD will deliver him when the times are evil.
41.2: The LORD will protect him and keep him alive; he will be blessed in the land; and he will not be handed over to the desires of his enemies.
41.3: The LORD will uphold him even on his sickbed; you will transform his bed of illness into health.
41.4: As for me, I said, "LORD, be gracious to me! Heal me, for I have sinned against you!"
41.5: As for my enemies, with malice they said, "When will he die and memory of his name perish?"
41.6: The one who comes to visit me speaks lies; in his heart he thinks slanderous things about me and goes around spreading them.
41.7: As for all who hate me, they whisper together against me; they desire to do me harm.
41.8: They say, "Wickedness is entrenched in him. Once he is brought low, he will not rise again."
41.9: As for my best friend, the one in whom I trusted, the one who ate my bread, even he has insulted me!
41.10: But you, LORD, be gracious to me and raise me up so that I may pay them back!
41.11: In this way I will know that you are pleased with me, and that my enemies will not shout in triumph over me.
41.12: As for me, you will maintain my just cause, and you will cause me to stand in your presence forever.
41.13: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, from eternity to eternity. Amen and amen!

42.1: As an antelope pants for streams of water, so my soul pants for you, God.
42.2: My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When may I come and appear in God's presence?
42.3: My tears have been my food day and night, while people keep asking me all day long, "Where is your God?"
42.4: These things I will recall as I pour out my troubles within me: I used to go with the crowd in a procession to the house of God, accompanied with shouts of joy and thanksgiving.
42.5: Why are you in despair, my soul? Why are you disturbed within me? Hope in God, for once again I will praise him, since his presence saves me.
42.6: My God, my soul feels depressed within me; therefore I will remember you from the land of Jordan, from the heights of Hermon, even from the foothills.
42.7: Deep waters call out to what is deeper still; at the roar of your waterfalls all your breakers and your waves swirled over me.
42.8: By day the LORD will command his gracious love, and by night his song is with me— a prayer to the God of my life.
42.9: I will ask God, my Rock, "Why have you forsaken me? Why do I go around mourning under the enemy's oppression?"
42.10: Like the shattering of my bones are the taunts of my oppressors, saying to me all day long, "Where is your God?"
42.11: Why are you in despair, my soul? Why are you disturbed within me? Hope in God, for once again I will praise him, since his presence saves me and he is my God.

43.1: You be my judge, God, and plead my case against an unholy nation; rescue me from the deceitful and unjust man.
43.2: Since you are the God who strengthens me, why have you forsaken me? Why do I go around mourning under the enemy's oppression?"
43.3: Send forth your light and your truth so they may guide me. Let them bring me to your holy mountain and to your dwelling places.
43.4: Then I will approach the altar of God, even to God in whom my joy finds its source. Then I will praise you with the lyre, God, my God,
43.5: Why are you in despair, my soul? Why are you disturbed within me? Hope in God, because I will praise him once again, since his presence saves me and he is my God.

44.1: God, we heard it with our ears; our ancestors told us about what you did in their day— a long time ago.
44.2: With your hand you expelled the nations and established our ancestors. You afflicted nations and cast them out.
44.3: It was not with their sword that they inherited the land, nor did their own arm deliver them. But it was by your power, your strength, and by the light of your face; because you were pleased with them.
44.4: You are my king, God, command victories for Jacob.
44.5: Through you we will knock down our oppressors; through your name we will tread down those who rise up against us.
44.6: For I place no confidence in my bow, nor will my sword deliver me.
44.7: For you delivered us from our oppressors and put to shame those who hate us.
44.8: We will praise God all day long; and to your name we will give thanks forever. Interlude
44.9: However, you cast us off and made us ashamed! You did not even march with our armies!
44.10: You made us retreat from our oppressors. Our enemies ransacked us.
44.11: You handed us over to be slaughtered like sheep and you scattered us among the nations.
44.12: You sold out your people for nothing, and made no profit at that price.
44.13: You made us a laughing stock to our neighbors, a source of mockery and derision to those around us.
44.14: You made us an object lesson among the nations; people shake their heads at us.
44.15: My dishonor tortures me continuously; the shame on my face overwhelms me
44.16: because of the voice of the one who mocks and reviles, because of the enemy and the avenger.
44.17: All this came upon us, yet we did not forsake you, and we have not dealt falsely with your covenant;
44.18: Our hearts have not turned away; our steps have not swerved from your path.
44.19: Nevertheless, you crushed us in the lair of jackals, and covered us in deep darkness.
44.20: If we had forgotten the name of our God or lifted our hands to a foreign god,
44.21: wouldn't God find out since he knows the secrets of the heart?
44.22: For your sake we are being killed all day long. We are thought of as sheep to be slaughtered.
44.23: Wake up! Why are you asleep, Lord? Get up! Don't cast us off forever!
44.24: Why are you hiding your face? Why are you ignoring our affliction and oppression?
44.25: For we have collapsed in the dust; our bodies cling to the ground.
44.26: Arise! Deliver us! Redeem us according to your gracious love!

45.1: My heart is overflowing with good news; I speak what I have composed to the king; my tongue is like the pen of an articulate scribe.
45.2: You are the most handsome of Adam's descendants; grace has anointed your lips; therefore God has blessed you forever.
45.3: Strap your sword to your side, mighty warrior, along with your honor and majesty.
45.4: In your majesty ride forth for the cause of truth, humility, and righteousness; and your strong right hand will teach you awesome things.
45.5: Your arrows are sharpened to penetrate the hearts of the king's enemies. People will fall under you.
45.6: Your throne, God, exists forever and ever, and the scepter of your kingdom is a righteous scepter.
45.7: You love justice and hate wickedness. That is why God, even your God, has anointed you rather than your companions with the oil of gladness.
45.8: All your clothes are scented with myrrh, aloes, and cassia. From ivory palaces stringed instruments have made you glad.
45.9: The king's daughters are among your honorable women; the queen, dressed in gold from Ophir, has taken her place at your right hand."
45.10: Listen, daughter! Consider and pay attention. Forget your people and your father's house,
45.11: and the king will greatly desire your beauty. Because he is your lord, you should bow in respect before him.
45.12: The daughter of Tyre will come with a wedding gift; wealthy people will entreat your favor.
45.13: In her chamber, the king's daughter is glorious; her clothing is embroidered with gold thread.
45.14: In embroidered garments she is presented to the king. Her virgin companions who follow her train will be presented to you.
45.15: Filled with joy and gladness, they are presented when they enter the king's palace.
45.16: Your sons will take the place of your ancestors, and you will set them up as princes in all the earth.
45.17: From generation to generation, I will cause your name to be remembered. Therefore people will thank you forever and ever.

46.1: God is our refuge and strength, a great help in times of distress.
46.2: Therefore we will not be frightened when the earth roars, when the mountains shake in the depths of the seas,
46.3: when its waters roar and rage, when the mountains tremble despite their pride. Interlude
46.4: Look! There is a river whose streams make the city of God rejoice, even the Holy Place of the Most High.
46.5: Since God is in her midst, she will not be shaken. God will help her at the break of dawn.
46.6: The nations roared; the kingdoms were shaken. His voice boomed; the earth melts.
46.7: The LORD of the heavenly armies is with us; our refuge is the God of Jacob. Interlude
46.8: Come, observe the mighty works of the LORD, who causes desolation in the earth.
46.9: He causes wars to cease all over the earth, he causes the bow to break, the spear to snap, the chariots to ignite and burn.
46.10: Be in awe and know that I am God. I will be exalted among the nations. I will be exalted throughout the earth.
46.11: The LORD of the heavenly armies is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Interlude

47.1: Clap your hands, all you peoples! Shout to God with a loud cry of joy!
47.2: For the LORD, the Most High, is to be feared, a great king over all the earth.
47.3: He subdued peoples under us, and nations under our feet.
47.4: He chose our inheritance for us, even the pride of Jacob whom he loved. Interlude
47.5: God has ascended on high with a shout, the LORD has ascended with the blast of a trumpet.
47.6: Sing songs to God! Sing songs! Sing songs to our King! Sing songs!
47.7: Indeed, God is king over all the earth; sing a song of praise.
47.8: God is king over the nations; God is seated on his holy throne.
47.9: The nobles among the nations have joined the people of the God of Abraham. For the shields of the earth belong to God; he is greatly exalted.

48.1: Great is the LORD! For he is to be praised greatly, even in the city of our God, his holy mountain.
48.2: Beautifully situated, the joy of all the earth, Mount Zion towards the north, the city of the great King.
48.3: Within her citadels God is known as a place of refuge.
48.4: Behold, when the kings assembled together, when they traveled together,
48.5: they looked and were awestruck; they became afraid and ran away.
48.6: Trembling seized them there, pains like those of a woman in labor,
48.7: as when an east wind destroyed the ships of Tarshish.
48.8: Just as we have heard, so have we seen; in the city of the LORD of the heavenly armies— even in the city of our God— God will establish her forever. Interlude
48.9: God, we have meditated on your gracious love in the midst of your Temple.
48.10: God, according to your name, so is your praise to the ends of the earth. Your right hand is filled with righteousness.
48.11: Mount Zion will be glad; the towns of Judah will rejoice because of your judgments.
48.12: March around Zion; encircle her; count her towers.
48.13: Take note of her ramparts; investigate her citadels; that you may speak about them to the next generation.
48.14: For this God is our God forever and ever. He will guide us until death.

49.1: Listen to this, all you people! Pay attention, all you who live in the world,
49.2: both average people and those of means, the rich and the poor together.
49.3: My mouth will speak wisely, and I will understand what I think about.
49.4: I will focus my attention on a proverb; I will use the harp to expound my riddle.
49.5: Why should I be afraid when evil days come my way, when the wickedness of those who deceive me surrounds me—
49.6: those who put confidence in their wealth and boast about their great riches?
49.7: No man can redeem the life of another, nor can he give to God a sufficient payment for him—
49.8: for it would cost too much to redeem his life, and the payments would go on forever—
49.9: that he should go on living and not see corruption.
49.10: Indeed, he will see wise people die; the stupid and the senseless will meet their doom and leave their wealth to others.
49.11: Their inner thoughts are on their homes forever; their dwellings from generation to generation. They even name their lands after themselves.
49.12: But humanity cannot last, despite its conceit; it will pass away just like the animals.
49.13: This is the fate of those who are foolish and of those who correct their words after they speak. Interlude
49.14: Like sheep, they are destined for the realm of the dead, with death as their shepherd. The upright will have dominion over them in the morning; their strength will be consumed in the afterlife, so that they have no home.
49.15: God will truly redeem me from the power of Sheol. He will surely receive me! Interlude
49.16: Don't be afraid when someone gets rich, when the glory of his household increases.
49.17: When he dies, he will not be able to take it all with him — his possessions will not follow him to the grave,
49.18: although he considers himself blessed while he's alive. Though people praise you for doing well,
49.19: you will end up like your ancestors' generation, never again to see the light of day!
49.20: Humanity, despite its conceit, does not understand that it will perish, just like the animals.

50.1: God, the LORD, has spoken. He has summoned the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting place.
50.2: From Zion, the perfection of beauty, God has shined forth.
50.3: Our God has appeared and he has not been silent; a devouring fire blazed before him, and a mighty storm swirled around him.
50.4: He summoned the heavens above and the earth below, to sit in judgment on his people.
50.5: "Assemble before me, my saints, who have entered into my covenant by sacrifice."
50.6: The heavens revealed his justice, for God is himself the judge. Interlude
50.7: "Listen, my people, for I am making a pronouncement: Israel, I, God, your God, am testifying against you.
50.8: I do not rebuke you because of your sacrifices; indeed, your burnt offerings are continuously before me.
50.9: I will no longer accept a sacrificial bull from your household; nor goats from your pens.
50.10: Indeed, every animal of the forest is mine, even the cattle on a thousand hills.
50.11: I know all the birds in the mountains; indeed, everything that moves in the field is mine.
50.12: "If I were hungry, I would not tell you; for the world is mine along with everything in it.
50.13: Why should I eat the flesh of oxen or drink the blood of goats?
50.14: Offer to God a thanksgiving praise; pay your vows to the Most High.
50.15: Call on me in the day of distress; I will deliver you, and you will glorify me."
50.16: As for the wicked, God says, "How dare you recite my statutes or speak about my covenant with your lips!
50.17: You hate instruction and toss my words behind you.
50.18: When you see a thief, you befriend him, and you keep company with adulterers.
50.19: You give your mouth free reign for evil, and your tongue devises deceit.
50.20: You sit and speak against your brother; you slander your own mother's son.
50.21: These things you did, and I kept silent, because you assumed that I was like you. But now I am going to rebuke you, and I will set forth my case before your very own eyes."
50.22: Consider this, you who have forgotten God— Otherwise, I will tear you in pieces and there will be no deliverer:
50.23: Whoever offers a sacrifice of thanksgiving glorifies me, and I will reveal the salvation of God to whomever continues in my way."

51.1: Have mercy, God, according to your gracious love, according to your unlimited compassion, erase my transgressions.
51.2: Wash me from my iniquity, cleanse me from my sin.
51.3: For I acknowledge my transgression; my sin remains continuously before me.
51.4: Against you, you only, have I sinned, and done what was evil in your sight. As a result, you are just in your pronouncement and clear in your judgment.
51.5: Indeed, in iniquity I was brought forth; in sin my mother conceived me.
51.6: Indeed, you are pleased with truth in the inner person, and you will teach me wisdom in my innermost parts.
51.7: Purge me with hyssop, and I will be clean. Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
51.8: Let me know joy and gladness; let the bones that you have broken rejoice.
51.9: Hide your countenance from my sins and erase the record of my iniquities.
51.10: God, create a pure heart in me, and renew a right attitude within me.
51.11: Do not cast me from your presence; do not take your Holy Spirit from me.
51.12: Restore to me the joy of your salvation, and let a willing attitude control me.
51.13: Then I will teach transgressors about your ways, and sinners will turn to you.
51.14: Deliver me from the guilt of shedding blood, God, God of my salvation. Then my tongue will sing about your righteousness.
51.15: Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will declare your praise.
51.16: Indeed, you do not delight in sacrifices, or I would give them, nor do you desire burnt offerings.
51.17: True sacrifice to God is a broken spirit. A broken and chastened heart, God, you will not despise.
51.18: Show favor to Zion in your good pleasure; and rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
51.19: Then you will be pleased with right sacrifices, with burnt offerings, and with whole burnt offerings. Then they will offer bulls on your altar.

52.1: Why do you make evil the foundation of your boasting, mighty one? God's gracious love never ceases.
52.2: Your tongue, like a sharp razor, devises wicked things and crafts treachery.
52.3: You love evil rather than good, falsehood rather than speaking uprightly. Interlude
52.4: You love all words that destroy, you deceitful tongue!
52.5: But God will tear you down forever; he will take you away, even snatching you out of your tent! He will uproot you from the land of the living. Interlude
52.6: The righteous will fear when they see this, but then they will laugh at him, saying,
52.7: "Look, here is a young man who refused to make God his strength; instead, he trusted in his great wealth and made his wickedness his strength.
52.8: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God; I trust in the gracious love of God forever and ever.
52.9: Therefore I will praise you forever because of what you did; I will proclaim that your name is good in the midst of your faithful ones.

53.1: Fools say to themselves "There is no God." They are corrupt and commit iniquity; not one of them practices what is good.
53.2: God looks down from the heavens upon humanity to see if anyone shows discernment as he searches for God.
53.3: All of them have fallen away; together they have become corrupt; no one does what is good, not even one.
53.4: Will those who do evil ever learn? They devour my people like they devour bread, and never call on God.
53.5: There the Israelis were seized with terror, when there was nothing to fear. For God scattered the bones of those who laid siege against you — you put them to shame, for God rejected them.
53.6: Would that Israel's deliverance come out of Zion! When God restores the fortunes of his people, Jacob will rejoice and Israel will be glad.

54.1: God, by your name deliver me, and by your power vindicate me.
54.2: God, listen to my prayer, and pay attention to the words of my mouth.
54.3: For the arrogant have arisen against me; oppressors have sought to take my life. They do not keep God in mind! Interlude
54.4: Look, God is my helper; the Lord is with those who are guarding my life.
54.5: He will turn the evil upon those who lie in wait for me. Cut them off with your truth.
54.6: With a free will offering I will sacrifice to you; I will give thanks to your name, LORD, because it is good,
54.7: for he has delivered me from every trouble, and my eyes have seen the end of my enemies.

55.1: Pay attention to my prayer, God, and do not hide yourself from my appeal.
55.2: Pay attention to me and answer me. I moan and groan in my thoughts,
55.3: because of the voice of the enemy, and because of the oppression of the wicked. They bring down evil upon me, and in anger they hate me.
55.4: My heart is trembling within me, and the terrors of death have assaulted me.
55.5: Fear and trembling have overwhelmed me, and horror has covered me.
55.6: I said, "O, who will give me the wings of a dove, so that I could fly away and live somewhere else?
55.7: Look, I want to flee far away; I want to settle down in the wilderness. Interlude
55.8: I want to deliver myself quickly from this windstorm and tempest."
55.9: Confound them, Lord, and confuse their speech, because I have seen violence and strife in the city.
55.10: Day and night they prowl around its walls; evil and iniquity are within it.
55.11: Wickedness is at the center of it; fraud and lies never leave its streets.
55.12: For it is not an enemy who insults me— I could have handled that— nor is it someone who hates me and who now arises against me— I could have hidden myself from him—
55.13: but it is you— a man whom I treated as my equal— my personal confidant, my close friend!
55.14: We had good fellowship together; and we even walked together in the house of God!
55.15: Let death seize them! May they be plunged alive into the afterlife, for wicked things are in their homes and among them.
55.16: I call upon God, and the LORD will deliver me.
55.17: Morning, noon, and night, I mulled over these things and cried out in my distress, and he heard my voice.
55.18: He calmly ransomed my soul from the war waged against me, for there was a vast crowd who stood against me.
55.19: God, who is enthroned from long ago, will hear me and humble them. Interlude Because they do not repent, they do not fear God.
55.20: Each of my friends raises his hand against his allies; each of my friends breaks his word.
55.21: His mouth is as smooth as butter, while war is in his heart. His words were as smooth as olive oil, while his sword is drawn.
55.22: Cast on the LORD whatever he sends your way, and he will sustain you. He will never allow the righteous to be shaken.
55.23: But you, God, bring them down to the Pit of corruption; bloodthirsty and deceitful people will not live out half their days. But I put my full confidence in you.

56.1: Have mercy on me, God, because men have harassed me. Those who oppress me have fought against me all day long.
56.2: Those who watch me all day have harassed me, for there are many who fight against me out of conceit.
56.3: On days when I am afraid, I put my trust in you.
56.4: In God, whose word I praise, in God I put my trust. I will not fear what mortal man can do to me.
56.5: All day long people distort what I say; all their schemes against me are for evil purposes.
56.6: They gather together and hide in ambush. They watch my every step as they lie in wait for my life.
56.7: Cast them away because of their wickedness. In wrath, God, cast down these people!
56.8: You have kept count of my wanderings. Put my tears in your bottle— have not you recorded them in your book?
56.9: My enemies will retreat when I call on you. This has been my experience, because God is with me.
56.10: In God, whose word I praise, in the LORD, whose word I praise,
56.11: in God I will put my trust. I will not fear what mortal man can do to me.
56.12: God, I have taken vows before you; therefore I will offer thanksgiving sacrifices to you.
56.13: For you have delivered me from death and my feet from stumbling, so that I may walk before God in the light of the living!

57.1: Have mercy on me, God, have mercy, for in you I have placed my trust. Even in the shadow of your wings will I find my refuge until this calamity passes.
57.2: I call upon the God Most High; to the God who completes what he began in me.
57.3: He will send help from heaven to deliver me from those who harass and despise me. Interlude God will send his gracious love and truth.
57.4: I am surrounded by lions. I lie down with those who burn with fire— that is, with people whose teeth are like spears and arrows— whose tongues are like sharp swords.
57.5: Be exalted above the heavens, God! May your glory cover the earth!
57.6: They have set a snare for my feet, which makes me depressed. They dug a pit in front of me, but they are the ones who fell into it! Interlude
57.7: My heart is committed, God, my heart is committed, so I will sing and play music.
57.8: Wake up, my soul, wake up, lyre and harp! I will awaken at dawn.
57.9: I will exalt you among the peoples, Lord. I will play music among the nations.
57.10: For your gracious love is great, extending even to the heavens, and your truth even to the skies.
57.11: Be exalted above the heavens, God! May your glory cover the earth!

58.1: How is it that by remaining silent you can speak righteously? How can you judge people fairly?
58.2: As a matter of fact, in your heart you plan iniquities! In the land your hands are violent!
58.3: The wicked go astray from the womb; they go astray, telling lies even from birth.
58.4: Their venom is like a poisonous snake; even like a deaf serpent that shuts its ears,
58.5: refusing to hear the voice of the snake charmer, the cunning enchanter.
58.6: God, shatter their teeth in their mouths; LORD, break the fangs of the young lions!
58.7: May they flow away like rain water that runs off, may they become like someone who shoots broken arrows.
58.8: May they be like a snail that dries up as it crawls; like a woman's stillborn baby, who never saw the sun.
58.9: Before your clay pots are placed on a fire of burning thorns— whether green or ablaze— wrath will sweep them away like a storm.
58.10: The righteous person will rejoice when he sees your vengeance; when he washes his feet in the blood of the wicked.
58.11: A person will say, "Certainly, the righteous are rewarded; certainly there is a God who judges the earth."

59.1: Save me from my enemies, my God! Keep me safe from those who rise up against me.
59.2: Save me from those who practice evil; deliver me from bloodthirsty men.
59.3: Look, they lie in ambush for my life; these violent men gather together against me, but not because of any transgression or sin of mine, LORD.
59.4: Without any fault on my part, they rush together and prepare themselves. Get up! Come help me! Pay attention!
59.5: You, LORD God of the Heavenly Armies, God of Israel, stir yourself up to punish all the nations. Show no mercy to those wicked transgressors. Interlude
59.6: At night they return like howling dogs; they prowl around the city.
59.7: Look what pours out of their mouths! They use their lips like swords, saying "Who will hear us?"
59.8: But you, LORD, will laugh at them; you will mock all the nations.
59.9: My Strength, I will watch for you, for God is my fortress.
59.10: My God of Gracious Love will meet me; God will enable me to see what happens to my enemies.
59.11: Don't kill them! Otherwise, my people may forget. By your power make them stumble around; bring them down low, Lord, our Shield.
59.12: The sin of their mouth is the word on their lips. They will be caught in their own conceit; for they speak curses and lies.
59.13: Go ahead and destroy them in anger! Wipe them out, and they will know to the ends of the earth that God rules over Jacob. Interlude
59.14: At night they return like howling dogs; they prowl around the city.
59.15: They scavenge for food. If they find nothing, they become hungry and growl.
59.16: But I will sing of your power and in the morning I will shout for joy about your gracious love. For you have been a fortress for me; and a refuge when I am distressed.
59.17: My Strength, I will sing praises to you, for you, God of Gracious Love, are my fortress.

60.1: God, you have cast us off; you have breached our defenses and you have become enraged. Return to us!
60.2: You made the earth quake; you broke it open. Repair its fractures, because it has shifted.
60.3: You made your people go through hard times; you had us drink wine that makes us stagger.
60.4: But you have given a banner to those who fear you, so they may display it in honor of truth. Interlude
60.5: So your loved ones may be delivered, save us by your power and answer us quickly!
60.6: Then God spoke in his holiness, "I will rejoice— I will divide Shechem; I will portion out the Succoth Valley.
60.7: Gilead belongs to me, and Manasseh is mine. Ephraim is my helmet, and Judah my scepter.
60.8: Moab is my wash basin; over Edom I will throw my shoes; over Philistia I will celebrate my triumph."
60.9: Who will lead me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
60.10: Aren't you the one, God, who has cast us off? Didn't you refuse, God, to accompany our armies?
60.11: Help us in our distress, for human help is worthless.
60.12: Through God we will fight valiantly; and it is he who will crush our enemies.

61.1: God, hear my cry; pay attention to my prayer.
61.2: From the end of the earth I will cry to you whenever my heart is overwhelmed. Place me on the rock that's too high for me.
61.3: For you have been a refuge for me, a tower of strength before the enemy.
61.4: Let me make my home in your tent forever; let me hide under the shelter of your wings. Interlude
61.5: For you, God, have heard my promises; you have assigned to me the heritage of those who fear your name.
61.6: Add day after day to the king's life; may his years continue for many generations.
61.7: May he be enthroned before God forever; Appoint your gracious love and truth to guard him.
61.8: So I will sing songs to your name forever; I will fulfill my promises day by day.

62.1: My soul rests quietly only when it looks to God; from him comes my deliverance.
62.2: He alone is my rock, my deliverance, and my high tower; nothing will shake me.
62.3: How long will you rage against someone? Would you attack him as if he were a leaning wall or a tottering fence?
62.4: They plan to cast him down from his exalted position. They delight in lies; their mouth utters blessings, while their heart is cursing. Interlude
62.5: My soul, be quiet before God, for from him comes my hope.
62.6: He alone is my rock, my deliverance, and my high tower; nothing will shake me.
62.7: I rely on God who is my deliverance and my glory; he is my strong rock, and my refuge is in God.
62.8: People, in every situation put your trust in God; pour out your heart before him; for God is a refuge for us. Interlude
62.9: Human beings are a mere vapor, while people in high positions are not what they appear. When they are placed on the scales, they weigh nothing; even when weighed together, they are less than nothing.
62.10: Don't trust in oppression or put false hope in stealing; if you become wealthy, do not set your heart on it.
62.11: God spoke once, but I heard it twice, "Power belongs to God."
62.12: Also to you, Lord, belongs gracious love, because you reward each person according to what he does.

63.1: God, you are my God! I will fervently seek you. My soul thirsts for you; my flesh longs for you in a dry, weary, and parched land.
63.2: So I have looked for you in the sanctuary, to behold your power and glory.
63.3: Because your gracious love is better than life itself, my lips will praise you.
63.4: So I will bless you as long as I live; I will lift up my hands in your name.
63.5: Just as I am satisfied with the choicest of foods, so my lips will praise you joyfully.
63.6: When I think of you in bed, I will meditate on you in the night watches.
63.7: For you have been my strength, and in the shadow of your wings I will shout for joy.
63.8: My soul clings to you, even as your right hand supports me.
63.9: But as for those who seek to destroy me, they will go down to the depths of the earth;
63.10: May they be given over to the power of the sword; may they become carrion for jackals.
63.11: But as for the king, he will rejoice in God. Indeed, everyone who swears by God will exult, because the mouths of liars will be silenced.

64.1: Hear, God, as I express my concern; protect me from fear of the enemy.
64.2: Hide me from the secret plots of the wicked, from the mob of those who practice evil,
64.3: who sharpen their tongues like swords, and aim their bitter words like arrows,
64.4: shooting at the innocent from concealment. Suddenly they shoot, fearing nothing.
64.5: They concoct an evil scheme for themselves; they enumerate their hidden snares; they say, "Who will see them?"
64.6: They devise wicked schemes, saying, "We have completed our plans, hiding them deep in our hearts."
64.7: But God shot an arrow at them, and they were wounded immediately.
64.8: They tripped over their own tongues, and everyone who was watching ran away.
64.9: Everyone was gripped with fear and acknowledged God's deeds, understanding what he had done.
64.10: The righteous rejoiced in the LORD, because they had fled to him for refuge. Let all the upright in heart exult.

65.1: In Zion, God, praise silently awaits you, and vows will be paid to you.
65.2: Since you hear prayer, everybody will come to you.
65.3: My acts of iniquity—they overwhelm me! Our transgressions—you blot them out!
65.4: How blessed is the one you choose, the one you cause to live in your courts. We will be satisfied with the goodness of your house, yes, even with the holiness of your Temple.
65.5: With awesome deeds of justice you will answer us, God our Deliverer; you are the confidence for everyone at the ends of the earth, even for those far away overseas.
65.6: The One who established the mountains by his strength is clothed with omnipotence.
65.7: He calmed the roar of seas, the roaring of the waves, and the turmoil of the peoples.
65.8: Those living at the furthest ends of the earth are seized by fear because of your miraculous deeds. You make the going forth of the morning and the evening shout for joy.
65.9: You take care of the earth, you water it, and you enrich it greatly with the river of God that overflows with water. You provide grain for them, for you have ordained it this way.
65.10: You fill the furrows of the field with water so that their ridges overflow. You soften them with rain showers; their sprouts you have blessed.
65.11: You crown the year with your goodness; your footsteps drop prosperity behind them.
65.12: The wilderness pastures drip with dew, and the hills wrap themselves with joy.
65.13: The meadows are clothed with flocks of sheep, and the valleys are covered with grain. They shout for joy; yes, they burst out in song!

66.1: Shout praise to God all the earth!
66.2: Sing praise about the glory of his name. Make his praise glorious.
66.3: Say to God: "How awesome are your works! Because of your great strength your enemies cringe before you."
66.4: The whole earth worships you. They sing praise to you. They sing praise to your name. Interlude
66.5: Come and see the awesome works of God on behalf of human beings:
66.6: He turned the sea into dry land. Israel crossed the river on foot; let us rejoice in him.
66.7: He rules by his power forever, his eyes watching over the nations. Do not let the rebellious exalt themselves. Interlude
66.8: Bless our God, people, and let the sound of his praise be heard.
66.9: He gives us life and does not permit our feet to slip.
66.10: For you, God, tested us, to purify us like fine silver.
66.11: You have led us into a trap and set burdens on our backs.
66.12: You caused men to ride over us. You brought us through fire and water, but you led us to abundance.
66.13: I will come to your house with burnt offerings. I will fulfill my vows to you
66.14: that my lips uttered and that my mouth spoke when I was in trouble.
66.15: I will offer to you burnt offerings of fat, along with the smoke of the sacrifice of rams. I will offer bulls along with goats. Interlude
66.16: Come and listen, all of you who fear God, and I will tell you what he did for me.
66.17: I called aloud to him and praised him with my tongue.
66.18: Were I to cherish iniquity in my heart, the Lord would not listen to me.
66.19: Surely God has heard, and he paid attention to my prayers.
66.20: Blessed be God, who did not turn away my prayers nor his gracious love from me.

67.1: May God show us favor and bless us; may he truly show us his favor. Interlude
67.2: Let your ways be known by all the nations of the earth, along with your deliverance.
67.3: Let the people thank you, God. Let all the people thank you.
67.4: Let the nations rejoice and sing for joy, because you judge people with fairness and you govern the people of the earth. Interlude
67.5: Let the people thank you, God; let all the people thank you.
67.6: May the earth yield its produce. May God, our God, bless us.
67.7: May God truly bless us so that all the peoples of the earth will fear him.

68.1: God arises, and his enemies are scattered. Those who hate him flee from his presence.
68.2: As smoke is driven away, so you drive them away. As wax melts in the presence of fire, so the wicked die in the presence of God.
68.3: But the righteous rejoice and exult before God; they are overwhelmed with joy.
68.4: Sing to God! Sing praise to his name! Exalt the one who rides on the clouds. The LORD is his name. Be jubilant in his presence.
68.5: A father to orphans and an advocate for widows is God in his holy dwelling place.
68.6: God causes the lonely to dwell in families. He leads prisoners into prosperity, but rebels live on parched land.
68.7: God, when you led out your people, when you marched through the desert, Interlude
68.8: the land quaked. Indeed, the heavens poured down rain from the presence of God, this God of Sinai, from the presence of God, the God of Israel.
68.9: God, you poured out abundant rain on your inheritance. When Israel was weary, you sustained her.
68.10: Your people live there; you sustain the needy with your goodness, God.
68.11: The Lord issues a command. Numerous are the women who announce the news:
68.12: "Kings of armies retreat and flee, while the lady of the house divides the spoil.
68.13: When you men lie down among the sheepfolds, you are like the wings of the dove covered with silver, with its feathers in glittering gold."
68.14: When the Almighty scattered the kings there, there was snow on Mt. Zalmon.
68.15: The mountain of God is as the mountain of Bashan; a mountain of many peaks is Mount Bashan.
68.16: You mountains of many peaks, why do you watch with envy the mountain in which God has chosen to dwell? Indeed, the LORD will live there forever.
68.17: God's chariots were many thousands. The Lord was there with them at Sinai in holiness.
68.18: You ascended to the heights, you took captives. You received gifts among mankind, even the rebellious, so the LORD God may live there.
68.19: Blessed be the Lord who daily carries us. God is our deliverer.
68.20: God is for us the God of our deliverance. The Lord GOD rescues us from death.
68.21: God surely strikes the heads of his enemies, even the hairy heads of those who continue in their guilt.
68.22: The Lord says, "From Bashan I will bring them, I will bring them from the depths of the sea,
68.23: that your feet may wade through blood. The tongues of your dogs will have their portions from your enemies."
68.24: They have observed your processions, God, the processions of my God, my king, in the sanctuary.
68.25: The singers are in front, the musicians follow, strumming their stringed instruments among the maidens who are playing their tambourines.
68.26: Bless God in the great congregation, the LORD who is the fountain of Israel.
68.27: Little Benjamin is there, leading them, and the princes of Judah all together with the princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali.
68.28: Summon the power of your God, the power, God, that you have shown us.
68.29: Because of your Temple in Jerusalem, kings bring tribute to you.
68.30: Rebuke the wildlife that lives among the reeds, the nations that congregate like bulls and cows, humbling themselves with pieces of silver, for God scatters the nations that delight in battle.
68.31: Envoys will come from Egypt. Let the Ethiopians stretch out their hands to God.
68.32: You kingdoms of the earth, sing to God! Sing praises to the Lord, Interlude
68.33: to the one who rides the heavens, the ancient heavens. Behold! He thunders with a mighty voice.
68.34: Ascribe power to God, whose glory is over Israel, whose power is in the skies.
68.35: You are awesome, God, from your sanctuaries. The God of Israel is the one who gives strength and power to the people. Blessed be God!

69.1: Deliver me, God, because the waters are up to my neck.
