69.2: I am sinking in deep mire, and there is no solid ground. I have come into deep water, and the flood overwhelms me.
69.3: I am exhausted from calling for help. My throat is parched. My eyes are strained from looking for God.
69.4: Those who hate me without cause are more than the hairs of my head. My persecutors are mighty, and they want to destroy me. Must I be forced to return what I did not steal?
69.5: God, you know my sins, and my guilt is not hidden from you.
69.6: Do not let those who look up to you be ashamed because of me, Lord God of the Heavenly Armies. Let not those who seek you be humiliated because of me, God of Israel.
69.7: I am being mocked because of you. Dishonor overwhelms me.
69.8: I am a stranger to my brothers, a foreigner to my mother's sons.
69.9: Zeal for your house consumes me, and the mockeries of those who insult you fall on me.
69.10: I weep and fast, and I am mocked for it.
69.11: When I dressed in sackcloth, I became an object of gossip among them.
69.12: The prominent people mock me, composing drinking songs.
69.13: As for me, LORD, may my prayer to you come at a favorable time. God, in the abundance of your gracious love, answer me with your sure deliverance.
69.14: Rescue me from the mud and do not let me sink. Rescue me from those who hate me, and from the deep waters.
69.15: Let neither the floodwaters overwhelm me nor let the deep swallow me up, nor the mouth of the well close over me.
69.16: Answer me, LORD, for your gracious love is good; Turn to me in keeping with your great compassion,
69.17: and do not ignore your servant, because I am in distress. Hurry to answer me!
69.18: Draw near and redeem me; ransom me because of my enemies.
69.19: Truly you know my reproach, shame, and disgrace. All my enemies are known to you.
69.20: Insults broke my heart. I despaired and looked for sympathy; but there was none, for comforters, but I found none.
69.21: They put poison in my food, in my thirst they forced me to drink vinegar.
69.22: May their dining tables entrap them, and become a snare for their allies.
69.23: May their eyes be blinded and may their bodies tremble continuously.
69.24: May you pour out your fury on them. May your burning anger overtake them.
69.25: May their camp become desolate and their tents remain unoccupied.
69.26: For they persecute those whom you have struck, and they brag about the pain of those you have wounded.
69.27: May you punish them for their crimes; may they receive no verdict of innocence from you.
69.28: May they be erased from the Book of Life, and their names not be written with the righteous.
69.29: As for me, I am afflicted and hurting; may your deliverance, God, establish me on high.
69.30: Let me praise the name of God with a song that I may magnify him with thanksgiving.
69.31: That will please the LORD more than oxen and bulls with horns and hooves.
69.32: The afflicted will watch and rejoice. May you who seek God take courage.
69.33: For the LORD listens to the needy and doesn't despise those in bondage.
69.34: Let the heavens and earth praise him, along with the sea and its swarming creatures.
69.35: For God will deliver Zion and will rebuild the cities of Judah so they may live there and possess them.
69.36: The descendants of his servants will inherit it, and those who cherish his name will live there.

70.1: God, come to my rescue. LORD, hurry to help me.
70.2: May those who seek to kill me be publicly humiliated. May those who take pleasure in my harm be turned back in humiliation.
70.3: May those who say "Aha! Aha!" be turned back because of their shameful deeds.
70.4: Let those who seek you greatly rejoice in you. Let those who love your deliverance say, "May God be continuously exalted."
70.5: As for me, I am poor and needy. God, come quickly to me. You are my helper and my deliverer. LORD, please do not delay.

71.1: In you, LORD, I take refuge; let me never be humiliated.
71.2: Rescue and deliver me, because you are righteous. Turn your ear to me and save me.
71.3: Be my sheltering refuge where I may go continuously; command my deliverance for you are my rock and fortress.
71.4: My God, deliver me from the power of the wicked and the grasp of ruthless practicers of evil.
71.5: For you are my hope, Lord GOD, my security since I was young.
71.6: I depended on you since birth, when you brought me from my mother's womb; I praise you continuously.
71.7: I have become an example to many that you are my strong refuge.
71.8: My mouth is filled with your praise and your splendor daily.
71.9: Don't throw me away when I am old; do not abandon me when my strength fails.
71.10: For my enemies talk against me; those who seek to kill me plot together
71.11: and say, "God has abandoned him. Run after him and seize him, because there's no deliverer."
71.12: God, do not be distant from me. My God, come quickly to help me.
71.13: Let my adversaries be ashamed and consumed; let those who seek my destruction be covered with scorn and disgrace.
71.14: As for me, I will hope continuously and will praise you more and more.
71.15: I will declare your righteousness and your salvation every day, though I do not fully understand what the outcome will be.
71.16: Lord GOD, I will come in the power of your mighty acts, remembering your righteousness—yours alone.
71.17: God, you taught me from my youth, so I am still declaring your awesome deeds.
71.18: Also, when I reach old age and have gray hair, God, do not forsake me, until I have declared your power to this generation and your might to the next one.
71.19: Your many righteous deeds, God, are great,
71.20: God, who can compare to you, who caused me to experience troubles that were numerous and disastrous? You will return to revive me and lift me up from the depths of the earth.
71.21: You will increase my honor and comfort me once again.
71.22: I also will praise you with the harp; because of your faithfulness, my God, I will praise you with the lyre— Holy One of Israel.
71.23: My lips will shout for joy when I sing praise to you, whose life you have redeemed.
71.24: Moreover, my tongue will speak all day about your justice; for those who seek my destruction will be utterly humiliated.

72.1: God, endow the king with ability to render your justice, and the king's son to render your right decisions.
72.2: May he rule your people with right decisions and your oppressed ones with justice.
72.3: May the mountains bring prosperity to the people and the hills bring righteousness.
72.4: May he defend the afflicted of the people and deliver the children of the poor, but crush the oppressor.
72.5: May they fear you as long as the sun and moon shine — from generation to generation.
72.6: May he be like the rain that descends on mown grass, like showers sprinkling on the ground.
72.7: The righteous will flourish at the proper time and peace will prevail until the moon is no more.
72.8: May he rule from sea to sea, from the Euphrates River to the ends of the earth.
72.9: May the nomads bow down before him, and his enemies lick the dust.
72.10: May the kings of Tarshish and of distant shores bring gifts, and may the kings of Sheba and Seba offer tribute.
72.11: May all kings bow down to him, and all nations serve him.
72.12: For he will deliver the needy when they cry out for help, and the poor when there is no deliverer.
72.13: He will have compassion on the poor and the needy, and he will save the lives of the needy.
72.14: He will redeem them from oppression and violence, since their lives are precious in his sight.
72.15: May he live long and be given gold from Sheba, and may prayer be offered for him continuously, and may he be blessed every day.
72.16: May grain be abundant in the land all the way to the mountain tops; may its fruits flourish like the forests of Lebanon, and may the cities sprout like the grass of the earth.
72.17: May his fame be eternal— as long as the sun— may his name endure, and may they be blessed through him, and may all nations call him blessed.
72.18: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, who alone does awesome deeds.
72.19: And blessed be his glorious name forever, and may the whole earth be filled with his glory. Amen and amen!
72.20: This ends the prayers of Jesse's son David.

73.1: God is indeed good to Israel, to those pure in heart.
73.2: Now as for me, my feet nearly stumbled, as I almost lost my step.
73.3: For I was envious of the proud when I observed the prosperity of the wicked.
73.4: For there is no struggle at their deaths, and their bodies are healthy.
73.5: They do not experience problems common to ordinary people; they aren't afflicted as others are.
73.6: Therefore pride is their necklace and violence covers them like a garment.
73.7: Their eyes bulge from obesity and the imaginations of their mind cross the border into sin.
73.8: In their mockery they speak evil; from their arrogant position they speak oppression.
73.9: They choose to speak against heaven; while they talk about things on earth.
73.10: Therefore God's people return there and drink it all in like water until they're satiated.
73.11: Then they say, "How can God know? Does the Most High have knowledge?"
73.12: Just look at these wicked people! They're perpetually carefree as they increase their wealth.
73.13: I kept my heart pure for nothing and kept my hands clean from guilt.
73.14: For I suffer all day long and I am punished every morning.
73.15: If I say, "I will talk like this," I would betray a generation of your children.
73.16: When I tried to understand this, it was too difficult for me
73.17: until I entered the sanctuaries of God. Then I understood their destiny.
73.18: You have certainly set them in slippery places; you will make them fall to their ruin.
73.19: How desolate they quickly become, completely destroyed by calamities.
73.20: Like a dream when one awakens, Lord, you will despise their image when you arise.
73.21: When I chose to be bitter I was emotionally pained.
73.22: Then, I was too stupid and didn't realize I was acting like a wild animal with you.
73.23: But now I am always with you, for you keep holding my right hand.
73.24: You will guide me with your wise advice, and later you will receive me with honor.
73.25: Whom do I have in heaven but you? I desire nothing on this earth.
73.26: My body and mind may fail, but God is my strength and my portion forever.
73.27: Those far from you will perish; you will destroy those who are unfaithful to you.
73.28: As for me, how good for me it is that God is near! I have made the Lord GOD my refuge so I can tell about all your deeds.

74.1: Why, God? Have you rejected us forever? Your anger is burning against the sheep of your pasture.
74.2: Remember your community, whom you purchased long ago, the tribe whom you redeemed for your possession. Remember Mount Zion, where you live.
74.3: Hurry! Look at the permanent ruins— every calamity the enemy brought upon the Holy Place.
74.4: Those who are opposing you roar where we were meeting with you; they unfurl their war banners as signs.
74.5: As one blazes a trail through a forest with an ax,
74.6: now they're tearing down all its carved work with hatchets and hammers.
74.7: They burned your sanctuary to the ground, desecrating your dwelling place.
74.8: They say to themselves, "We'll crush them completely;" They burned down all the meeting places of God in the land.
74.9: We see no signs for us; there is no longer a prophet, and no one among us knows the future.
74.10: God, how long will the adversary scorn while the enemy despises your name endlessly?
74.11: Why do you not withdraw your hand— your right hand—from your bosom and destroy them?
74.12: But God is my king from ancient times, who brings acts of deliverance throughout the earth.
74.13: You split the sea by your own power. You shattered the heads of sea monsters in the water.
74.14: You crushed the heads of Leviathan. You set it as food for desert creatures.
74.15: You opened both the spring and the river; you dried up flowing rivers.
74.16: Yours is the day, and yours is the night; you established the moon and the sun.
74.17: You set all the boundaries of the earth; you made summer and winter.
74.18: Remember this: The enemy scorns the LORD and a foolish people despises your name.
74.19: Don't hand over the life of your dove to beasts; do not continuously forget your afflicted ones.
74.20: Pay attention to your covenant, for the dark regions of the earth are full of violence.
74.21: Don't let the oppressed return in humiliation. The poor and needy will praise your name.
74.22: Get up, God, and prosecute your case— remember that you're being scorned by fools all day long.
74.23: Don't ignore the shout of those opposing you, The uproar of those who rebel against you continuously.

75.1: We praise you, God! We praise you —your presence draws near— as we declare your wonderful deeds.
75.2: "At the time that I choose I will judge the righteous.
75.3: While the earth and all its inhabitants melt away, it is I who keep its pillars firm." Interlude
75.4: I will say to the proud, "Don't brag," and to the wicked, "Don't vaunt your strength.
75.5: Don't use your strength to fight heaven or speak from stubborn arrogance."
75.6: For exaltation comes not from the east, the west, or the wilderness,
75.7: since God is the judge. This one he will debase or that one he will exalt.
75.8: For there is a cup in the hand of the LORD, foaming with well-mixed wine that he will pour out, leaving only the dregs, from which all the wicked of the earth will drink.
75.9: But as for me, I will declare forever, singing praise to the God of Jacob.
75.10: I will cut down the strength of the wicked, but the strength of the righteous will be lifted up.

76.1: God is known in Judah; in Israel his reputation is great.
76.2: His abode is in Salem, his dwelling place in Zion.
76.3: There he shattered sharp arrows, shields, swords, and weapons of war. Interlude
76.4: You are enveloped by light; more majestic than mountains filled with game.
76.5: Brave men were plundered while they slumbered in their sleep. All the men of the army were immobilized.
76.6: At the sound of your battle cry, God of Jacob, both horse and chariot rider fell into deep sleep.
76.7: You are awesome! who can stand in your presence when you're angry?
76.8: From heaven you declared judgment. The earth stands in awe and is quiet
76.9: when God arose to execute justice and to deliver all the afflicted of the earth. Interlude
76.10: Even human anger praises you; you will wear the survivors of your wrath as an ornament.
76.11: Let everyone who surrounds the LORD your God make a vow and fulfill it to the Awesome One.
76.12: He will humble the arrogant commanders-in-chief, instilling fear among the kings of the earth.

77.1: I cry out to God! I cry out to God and he hears me.
77.2: When I was in distress, I sought the Lord; my hands were raised at night and they did not grow weary. I refused to be comforted.
77.3: I remember God, and I groan; I meditate, while my spirit grows faint. Interlude
77.4: You kept my eyes open; I was troubled and couldn't speak.
77.5: I thought of ancient times, considering years long past.
77.6: During the night I remembered my song. I meditate in my heart, and my spirit ponders.
77.7: Will the Lord reject me forever and not show favor again?
77.8: Has his gracious love ceased forever? Will his promise be unfulfilled in future generations?
77.9: Has God forgotten to be gracious? Has he in anger withheld his compassion? Interlude
77.10: So I say: "It causes me pain that the right hand of the Most High has changed."
77.11: I will remember the LORD'S deeds; indeed, I will remember your awesome deeds from long ago.
77.12: As I meditate on all your works, I will consider your awesome deeds.
77.13: God, your way is holy. What god is like our great God?
77.14: God, you are the one performing awesome deeds. You reveal your might among the nations.
77.15: You delivered your people— the descendants of Jacob and Joseph— with your power. Interlude
77.16: The waters saw you, God; the waters saw you and writhed. Indeed, the depths of the sea quaked.
77.17: The clouds poured rain; the skies rumbled. Indeed, your lightning bolts flashed.
77.18: Your thunderous sound was in a whirlwind; your lightning lights up the world; the earth becomes agitated and quakes.
77.19: Your way was through the sea, and your path through mighty waters, but your footprints cannot be traced.
77.20: You have led your people like a flock by the hands of Moses and Aaron.

78.1: Listen, my people, to my instruction. Hear the words of my mouth.
78.2: I will tell a parable, speaking riddles from long ago—
78.3: things that we have heard and known and that our ancestors related to us.
78.4: We will not withhold them from their descendants; we'll declare to the next generation the praises of the LORD— his might and awesome deeds that he has performed.
78.5: He established a decree in Jacob, and established the Law in Israel, that he commanded our ancestors to reveal to their children
78.6: in order that the next generation— children yet to be born— will know them and in turn teach them to their children.
78.7: Then they will put their trust in God and they will not forget his awesome deeds. Instead, they will keep his commandments.
78.8: They will not be like the rebellious generation of their ancestors, a rebellious generation, whose heart was not steadfast, and whose spirits were unfaithful to God.
78.9: The descendants of Ephraim were sharp shooters with the bow, but they retreated in the day of battle.
78.10: They did not keep God's covenant, and refused to live by his Law.
78.11: They have forgotten what he has done, his awesome deeds that they witnessed.
78.12: He performed marvelous things in the presence of their ancestors in the land of Egypt— in the fields of Zoan.
78.13: He divided the sea so that they were able to cross; he caused the water to stand in a single location.
78.14: He led them with a cloud during the day, and during the night with light from the fire.
78.15: He caused the rocks to split in the wilderness, and gave them water as from an abundant sea.
78.16: He brought streams from rock, causing water to flow like a river.
78.17: But time and again, they sinned against him, rebelling against the Most High in the desert.
78.18: To test God was in their minds, when they demanded food to satisfy their cravings.
78.19: They spoke against God by asking, "Is God able to prepare a feast in the desert?
78.20: It's true that Moses struck the rock so that water flowed forth and torrents of water gushed out, but is he also able to give bread or to supply meat for his people?"
78.21: Therefore, when the LORD heard this, he was angry, and fire broke out against Jacob. Moreover, his anger flared against Israel,
78.22: because they didn't believe in God and didn't trust in his deliverance.
78.23: Yet he commanded the skies above and the doors of the heavens to open,
78.24: so that manna rained down on them for food and he sent them the grain of heaven.
78.25: Mortal men ate the food of angels; he sent provision to them in abundance.
78.26: He stirred up the east wind in the heavens and drove the south wind by his might.
78.27: He caused meat to rain on them like dust and winged birds as the sand of the sea.
78.28: He caused these to fall in the middle of the camp and all around their tents.
78.29: So they ate and were very satisfied, because he granted their desire.
78.30: However, before they had fulfilled their desire, while their food was still in their mouths,
78.31: the anger of God flared against them, and he killed the strongest men and humbled Israel's young men.
78.32: In spite of all of this, they kept on sinning and didn't believe in his marvelous deeds.
78.33: So he made their days end in futility, and their years with sudden terror.
78.34: When he struck them, they sought him; they repented, and eagerly sought God.
78.35: Then they remembered that God was their rock, and the Most High God was their deliverer.
78.36: But they deceived him with their mouths; they lied to him with their tongues.
78.37: For their hearts weren't committed to him, and they weren't faithful to his covenant.
78.38: But he, being merciful, forgave their iniquity and didn't destroy them; He restrained his anger and didn't vent all his wrath.
78.39: For he remembered that they were only flesh, a passing wind that doesn't return.
78.40: How they rebelled against him in the desert, grieving him in the wilderness!
78.41: They tested God again and again, provoking the Holy One of Israel.
78.42: They did not remember his power— the day he delivered them from their adversary,
78.43: when he set his signs in Egypt and his wonders in the plain of Zoan.
78.44: He turned their rivers into blood and made their streams undrinkable.
78.45: He sent swarms of insects to bite them and frogs to destroy them.
78.46: He gave their crops to caterpillars and what they worked for to locusts.
78.47: He destroyed their vines with hail and their sycamore trees with frost.
78.48: He delivered their beasts to hail and their livestock to lightning bolts.
78.49: He inflicted his burning anger, wrath, indignation, and distress, sending destroying angels among them.
78.50: He blazed a path for his anger; he did not stop short from killing them, but handed them over to pestilence.
78.51: He struck every firstborn in Egypt, the first fruits of their manhood in the tents of Ham.
78.52: Yet he led out his people like sheep, guiding them like a flock in the desert.
78.53: He led them to safety so they would not fear. As for their enemies, the sea covered them.
78.54: He brought the people to the border of his holy mountain, which he acquired by his might.
78.55: He drove out nations before them and allotted their tribal inheritance, settling the tribes of Israel in their tents.
78.56: But they tested the Most High God by rebelling against him, and they did not obey his statutes.
78.57: They fell away and were as disloyal as their ancestors. They became unreliable, like a defective bow;
78.58: they angered him with their high places and with their carved images they made him jealous.
78.59: God heard and became furious, and he completely rejected Israel.
78.60: He abandoned the tent at Shiloh, the tent that he established among mankind.
78.61: Then he sent his might into captivity and his glory into the control of the adversary.
78.62: He delivered his people over to the sword and was angry with his possession.
78.63: The young men were consumed by fire, and the virgins had no marriage celebrations.
78.64: The priests fell by the sword, yet their widows couldn't weep.
78.65: The LORD awoke as though from sleep, like a mighty warrior stimulated by wine.
78.66: He beat back his adversaries, permanently disgracing them.
78.67: He rejected the clan of Joseph; and the tribe of Ephraim he did not choose.
78.68: But he chose the tribe of Judah, the mountain of Zion, which he loves.
78.69: He built his sanctuary, high as the heavens, like the earth that he established forever.
78.70: Then he chose his servant David, whom he took from the sheepfold.
78.71: He brought him from birthing sheep to care for Jacob, his people, Israel, his possession.
78.72: David shepherded them with a devoted heart, and led them with skillful hands.

79.1: God, nations have invaded your land to desecrate your holy Temple, to destroy Jerusalem,
79.2: to give the corpses of your servants as food for the birds of the skies and the flesh of your godly ones to the beasts of the earth;
79.3: to make their blood flow like water around Jerusalem, with no one being buried.
79.4: We have become a reproach to our neighbors, a mockery and a derision to those around us.
79.5: How long, LORD, will you be angry? Forever? Will your jealousy burn like fire?
79.6: Pour out your wrath upon the nations that do not acknowledge you, and over the kingdoms that do not call on your name.
79.7: For they consumed Jacob, making his dwelling place desolate.
79.8: Don't charge us for previous iniquity, but let your compassion come quickly to us, for we have been brought very low.
79.9: Help us, God, our deliverer, on account of your glorious name, deliver us and forgive our sins on account of your name.
79.10: Why should the nations say, "Where is their God?" Let vengeance for the blood of your servants be meted out before our eyes and among the nations.
79.11: Let the cries of the prisoners reach you. With the strength of your power, release those condemned to death.
79.12: Pay back our neighbors seven times the reproach with which they reproached you, LORD.
79.13: Then we, your people, the sheep of your pasture, will praise you always, from generation to generation. We will declare your praise.

80.1: Shepherd of Israel, listen! The one who leads Joseph like a flock, the one enthroned on the cherubim, display your glory.
80.2: Reveal your power before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, then come to our rescue.
80.3: God, restore us, show your favor and deliver us.
80.4: LORD God of the Heavenly Armies, when will your smoldering anger toward your people's prayers cease?
80.5: You fed them tears as their food, and caused them to drink a full measure of tears.
80.6: You have set us at strife against our neighbors and our enemies deride us.
80.7: God of the Heavenly Armies, restore us and show your favor, so we may be delivered.
80.8: You uprooted a vine from Egypt, and drove out nations to transplant it.
80.9: You cleared the ground so that its roots grew and filled the land.
80.10: Mountains were covered by its shadows, and the mighty cedars by its branches.
80.11: Its branches spread out to the Mediterranean Sea and its shoots to the Euphrates River.
80.12: Why did you break down its walls so that those who pass by pluck its fruits?
80.13: Wild boars of the forest gnaw at it, and creatures of the field feed on it.
80.14: God of the Heavenly Armies, return! Look down from heaven and see. Show care toward this vine.
80.15: The root that your right hand planted, the shoot that you tended for yourself,
80.16: was burned with fire, cut off, and destroyed on account of your rebuke.
80.17: May you support the man at your right hand; the son of man whom you have raised for yourself.
80.18: Then we will not turn away from you. Restore us, so we can call upon your name.
80.19: God of hosts, restore to us the light of your favor. Then we'll be delivered.

81.1: Sing joyfully to God, our strength. Raise a shout to the God of Jacob.
81.2: Sing a song and play the tambourine, the pleasant-sounding lyre along with the harp.
81.3: Blow the ram's horn when there is a New Moon, when there is a full moon, on our festival day,
81.4: because it is a statute in Israel, an ordinance by the God of Jacob,
81.5: a decree that he prescribed for Joseph when he went throughout the land of Egypt, speaking a language I did not recognize.
81.6: I removed the burden from your shoulder; your hands were freed of the burdensome basket.
81.7: In a time of need you called out and I delivered you; I answered you from the dark thundercloud; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Interlude
81.8: Listen, My people and I will warn you. Israel, if only you would obey me!
81.9: You must neither have a foreign god over you or worship a strange god.
81.10: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, open your mouth that I may fill it.
81.11: Yet my people didn't obey my voice; Israel didn't submit to me.
81.12: So I allowed them to continue in their stubbornness, living by their own advice.
81.13: If only my people would obey me, if only Israel would walk in my ways!
81.14: Then I would quickly subdue their enemies. I would turn against their foes.
81.15: Those who hate the LORD will cringe before him; their punishment will be permanent.
81.16: But I will feed Israel with the finest wheat, satisfying you with honey from the rock.

82.1: God takes his stand in the divine assembly; among the divine beings he renders judgment:
82.2: "How long will you judge partially by showing favor on the wicked? Interlude
82.3: "Defend the poor and the fatherless. Vindicate the afflicted and the poor.
82.4: Rescue the poor and the needy, delivering them from the power of the wicked.
82.5: They neither know nor understand; they walk about in the dark while all the foundations of the earth are shaken.
82.6: "Indeed I said, 'You are gods, and all of you are sons of the Most High.
82.7: However, as all human beings do, you will die, and like other rulers, you will fall.'
82.8: Arise, God, to judge the earth, for all nations belong to you.

83.1: God, do not rest! Don't be silent! Don't stay inactive, God!
83.2: See! Your enemies rage; those who hate you issue threats.
83.3: They plot against your people and conspire against your cherished ones.
83.4: They say, "Let us go and erase them as a nation so the name of Israel will not be remembered anymore."
83.5: Indeed, they shrewdly planned together, forming an alliance against you—
83.6: the tents of Edom, the Ishmaelites, Moab, the Hagrites,
83.7: Gebal, Ammon, Amalek, Philistia, and the inhabitants of Tyre.
83.8: Even Assyria joined them to strengthen the descendants of Lot. Interlude
83.9: Deal with them as you did to Midian, Sisera, and Jabin at the Kishon Brook.
83.10: They were destroyed at En-dor and became as dung on the ground.
83.11: Punish their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, and all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
83.12: who said, "Let us possess the pastures of God."
83.13: God, set them up like dried thistles, like straw before the wind.
83.14: Like a fire burning a forest, and a flame setting mountains ablaze.
83.15: Pursue them with your storm and terrify them with your whirlwind.
83.16: Fill their faces with shame until they seek your name, God.
83.17: Let them be humiliated and terrified permanently until they die in shame.
83.18: Then they will know that you alone— whose name is LORD— are the Most High over all the earth.

84.1: How lovely are your dwelling places, LORD of the Heavenly Armies.
84.2: I desire and long for the Temple courts of the LORD. My heart and body sing for joy to the living God.
84.3: Even the sparrow found a house for herself and the swallow a nest to lay her young at your altar, LORD of the Heavenly Armies, my king and God.
84.4: How happy are those who live in your Temple, for they can praise you continuously. Interlude
84.5: How happy are those whose strength is in you, whose heart is on your path.
84.6: They will pass through the Baca Valley where he will prepare a spring for them; even the early rain will cover it with blessings.
84.7: They will walk from strength to strength; each will appear before God in Zion.
84.8: LORD God of the Heavenly Armies, hear my prayer! Listen, God of Jacob! Interlude
84.9: God, look at our shield, and show favor to your anointed,
84.10: for a day in your Temple courts is better than a thousand elsewhere; I would rather stand at the entrance of God's house than live in the tent of wickedness.
84.11: For the LORD God is a sun and shield; the LORD grants grace and favor; the LORD will not withhold any good thing from those who walk blamelessly.
84.12: LORD of Heavenly Armies, how happy are those who trust in you.

85.1: LORD you have favored your land and restored the fortunes of Jacob.
85.2: You took away the iniquity of your people, forgiving all their sins Interlude
85.3: You withdrew all your wrath and turned away from your burning anger.
85.4: Restore us, God of our salvation, and stop being angry with us.
85.5: Will you be angry with us forever? Will you prolong your anger from generation to generation?
85.6: Will you restore our lives again so that your people may rejoice in you?
85.7: LORD, show your gracious love and deliver us.
85.8: Let me listen to what God, the LORD, says; for the LORD will promise peace to his people, to his holy ones; may they not return to foolishness.
85.9: Surely, he will soon deliver those who fear him, for his glory will live in our land.
85.10: Gracious love and truth meet; righteousness and peace kiss.
85.11: Truth sprouts up from the ground, while righteousness looks down from the sky.
85.12: The LORD will also provide what is good, and our land will yield its produce.
85.13: Righteousness will go before him to prepare a path for his steps.

86.1: LORD, listen and answer me, for I am afflicted and needy.
86.2: Protect me, for I am faithful; My God, deliver your servant who trusts in you.
86.3: Have mercy on me Lord, for I call on you all day long.
86.4: Your servant rejoices, because, Lord, I set my hope on you.
86.5: Indeed you, Lord, are kind and forgiving, overflowing with gracious love to everyone who calls on you.
86.6: Hear my prayer, LORD; attend to my prayer of supplication.
86.7: In my troubled times I will call on you, for you will answer me.
86.8: No one can compare with you among the gods, Lord; No one can accomplish your work.
86.9: All the nations that you have established will come and worship you, my Lord. They will honor your name.
86.10: For you are great, and you are doing awesome things; you alone are God.
86.11: Teach me your ways, LORD, that I may walk in your truth; let me wholeheartedly revere your name.
86.12: I will praise you, Lord my God, with my whole being; and I will honor your name continuously.
86.13: For great is your gracious love to me; you've delivered me from the depths of Sheol.
86.14: God, arrogant men rise up against me, while a company of ruthless individuals want to kill me. They do not have regard for you.
86.15: But you, Lord, are a compassionate God, merciful and patient, with unending gracious love and faithfulness.
86.16: Return to me and have mercy on me; clothe your servant with your strength and deliver the son of your maid servant.
86.17: Show me a sign of your goodness, so that those who hate me will see it and be ashamed. For you, LORD, will help and comfort me.

87.1: God's foundation is in the holy mountains.
87.2: The LORD loves the gates of Zion more than the dwellings of Jacob.
87.3: Glorious things are spoken about you, city of God. Interlude
87.4: I will mention Rahab and Babylon among those who acknowledge me— including Philistia, Tyre, and Ethiopia — "This one was born there," they say.
87.5: Indeed, about Zion it will be said: "More than one person was born in it," and "The Most High himself did it."
87.6: The LORD will record, as he registers the peoples, "This one was born there." Interlude
87.7: Then singers, as they play their instruments, will declare, "All my roots are in you."

88.1: LORD, God of my salvation, by day and by night I cry out before you.
88.2: Let my prayer come before you; listen to my cry.
88.3: For my life is filled with troubles as I approach Sheol.
88.4: I am considered as one of those descending into the Pit, like a mighty man without strength,
88.5: released to remain with the dead, lying in a grave like a corpse, remembered no longer, and cut off from your power.
88.6: You have assigned me to the lowest part of the Pit, to the darkest depths.
88.7: Your anger lies heavily upon me; you pound me with all your waves. Interlude
88.8: You caused my acquaintances to shun me; you make me extremely abhorrent to them. Restrained, I am unable to go out.
88.9: My eyes languish on account of my affliction; all day long I call out to you, LORD, I spread out my hands to you.
88.10: Can you perform wonders for the dead? Can departed spirits stand up to praise you? Interlude
88.11: Can your gracious love be declared in the grave or your faithfulness in Abaddon?
88.12: Can your awesome deeds be known in darkness or your righteousness in the land of oblivion?
88.13: As for me, I cry out to you LORD, and in the morning my prayer greets you.
88.14: Why, LORD, have you rejected me? Why have you hidden your face from me?
88.15: Since my youth I have been oppressed and in danger of death. I bear your dread and am overwhelmed.
88.16: Your burning anger overwhelms me; your terrors destroy me.
88.17: Like waters, they engulf me all day long; they surround me on all sides.
88.18: You caused my friend and neighbor to shun me; and my acquaintances are confused.

89.1: I will sing forever about the gracious love of the LORD; from generation to generation I will declare your faithfulness with my mouth.
89.2: I will declare that your gracious love was established forever; in the heavens itself, you have established your faithfulness.
89.3: I have made a covenant with my chosen one; I have made a promise to David, my servant.
89.4: "I will establish your dynasty forever, and I will lift up one who will build your throne from generation to generation." Interlude
89.5: Even the heavens praise your awesome deeds, LORD, your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones.
89.6: For who in the skies compares to the LORD? Who is like the LORD among the divine beings?
89.7: God is feared in the council of the holy ones, revered by all those around him.
89.8: LORD God of the Heavenly Armies, who is as mighty as you, LORD? Your faithfulness surrounds you.
89.9: You rule over the majestic sea; when its waves surge, you calm them.
89.10: You crushed the proud one to death; with your powerful arm you scattered your enemies.
89.11: Heaven and the earth belong to you, the world and everything it contains— you established them.
89.12: The north and south—you created them; Tabor and Hermon joyously praise your name.
89.13: Your arm is strong; your hand is mighty; indeed, your right hand is victorious.
89.14: Righteousness and justice make up the foundation of your throne; gracious love and truth meet before you.
89.15: How happy are the people who can worship joyfully! LORD, they walk in the light of your presence.
89.16: In your name they rejoice all day long; they exult in your justice.
89.17: For you are their strength's grandeur; by your favor you exalted our power.
89.18: Indeed, our shield belongs to the LORD, and our king to the Holy One of Israel.
89.19: You spoke to your faithful ones through a vision: "I will set a helper over a warrior. I will raise up a chosen one from the people.
89.20: I have found my servant David; I have anointed him with my sacred oil,
89.21: with whom my power will be firmly established; for my arm will strengthen him.
89.22: No enemy will deceive him; no wicked person will afflict him.
89.23: I will crush his enemies before him and strike those who hate him.
89.24: My faithfulness and gracious love will be with him, and in my name his power will be exalted.
89.25: I will place his hand over the sea, and his right hand over the rivers.
89.26: He will announce to me 'You are my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.'
89.27: "Indeed, I myself made him the firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.
89.28: I will show my gracious love toward him forever, since my covenant is securely established with him.
89.29: I will establish his dynasty forever, and his throne as long as heaven endures.
89.30: "But if his sons abandon my laws and do not follow my ordinances,
89.31: if they profane my statutes; and do not keep my commands,
89.32: then I will punish their disobedience with a rod and their iniquity with lashes.
89.33: But I will not cut off my gracious love from him, and I will not stop being faithful.
89.34: I will not dishonor my covenant, because I will not change what I have spoken.
89.35: I have sworn by my holiness once for all: I will not lie to David.
89.36: His dynasty will last forever and his throne will be like the sun before me.
89.37: It will be established forever like the moon, a faithful witness in the sky." Interlude
89.38: But you have spurned, rejected, and became angry with your anointed one.
89.39: You have dishonored the covenant with your servant; you have defiled his crown on the ground.
89.40: You have broken through all his walls; you have laid his fortresses in ruin.
89.41: All who pass by on their way plunder him; he has become a reproach to his neighbors.
89.42: You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries; you have caused all of his enemies to rejoice.
89.43: Moreover, you have turned back the edge of his sword and did not support him in battle.
89.44: You have caused his splendor to cease and cast down his throne to the ground.
89.45: You have caused the days of his youth to be cut short; you have covered him with shame. Interlude
89.46: How long, LORD, will you hide yourself? Forever? Will your anger continuously burn like fire?
89.47: Remember how short my lifetime is! How powerless have you created all human beings!
89.48: What valiant man can live and not see death? Who can deliver himself from the power of Sheol. Interlude
89.49: Where is your gracious love of old, Lord, that in your faithfulness you promised to David?
89.50: Remember, Lord, the reproach of your servant! I carry inside me all the insults of many people,
89.51: when your enemies reproached you, LORD, when they reproached the footsteps of your anointed.
89.52: Blessed is the LORD forever! Amen and amen!

90.1: Lord, you've been our refuge from generation to generation.
90.2: Before the mountains were formed or the earth and the world were brought forth, you are God from eternity to eternity.
90.3: You return people to dust merely by saying, "Return, you mortals!"
90.4: One thousand years in your sight are but a single day that passes by, just like a night watch.
90.5: You will sweep them away while they are asleep— by morning they are like growing grass.
90.6: In the morning it blossoms and is renewed, but toward evening, it fades and withers.
90.7: Indeed, we are consumed by your anger and terrified by your wrath.
90.8: You have set our iniquities before you, what we have concealed in the light of your presence.
90.9: All our days pass away in your wrath; our years fade away and end like a sigh.
90.10: We live for 70 years, or 80 years if we're healthy, yet even in the prime years there are troubles and sorrow. They pass by quickly and we fly away.
90.11: Who can know the intensity of your anger? Because our fear of you matches your wrath,
90.12: teach us to keep account of our days so we may develop inner wisdom.
90.13: Please return, LORD! When will it be? Comfort your servants.
90.14: Satisfy us in the morning with your gracious love so we may sing for joy and rejoice every day.
90.15: Cause us to rejoice throughout the time when you have afflicted us, the years when we have known trouble.
90.16: May your awesome deeds be revealed to your servants, as well as your splendor to their children.
90.17: May your favor be on us, Lord our God; make our endeavors successful; yes, make our endeavors secure!

91.1: The one who lives in the shelter of the Most High, who rests in the shadow of the Almighty,
91.2: will say to the LORD, "You are my refuge, my fortress, and my God in whom I trust!"
91.3: He will surely deliver you from the hunter's snare and from the destructive plague.
91.4: With his feathers he will cover you, under his wings you will find safety. His truth is your shield and armor.
91.5: You need not fear terror that stalks in the night, the arrow that flies in the day,
91.6: plague that strikes in the darkness, or calamity that destroys at noon.
91.7: If a thousand fall at your side or ten thousand at your right hand, it will not overcome you.
91.8: Only observe it with your eyes, and you will see how the wicked are paid back.
91.9: "LORD, you are my refuge!" Because you chose the Most High as your dwelling place,
91.10: no evil will fall upon you, and no affliction will approach your tent,
91.11: for he will command his angels to protect you in all your ways.
91.12: With their hands they will lift you up so you will not trip over a stone.
91.13: You will stomp on lions and snakes; you will trample young lions and serpents.
91.14: Because he has focused his love on me, I will deliver him. I will protect him because he knows my name.
91.15: When he calls out to me, I will answer him. I will be with him in his distress. I will deliver him, and I will honor him.
91.16: I will satisfy him with long life; I will show him my deliverance.

92.1: It is good to give thanks to the LORD and to sing praise to your name, Most High;
92.2: to proclaim your gracious love in the morning and your faithfulness at night,
92.3: accompanied by a ten-stringed instrument and a lyre, and the contemplative sound of a harp.
92.4: Because you made me glad with your awesome deeds, LORD, I will sing for joy at the works of your hands.
92.5: How great are your works, LORD! Your thoughts are unfathomable.
92.6: A stupid man doesn't know, and a fool can't comprehend this:
92.7: Though the wicked sprout like grass; and all who practice iniquity flourish, it is they who will be eternally destroyed.
92.8: But you are exalted forever, LORD.
92.9: Look at your enemies, LORD! Look at your enemies, for they are destroyed; everyone who practices iniquity will be scattered.
92.10: You've grown my strength like the horn of a wild ox; I was anointed with fresh oil.
92.11: My eyes gloated over those who lie in wait for me; when those of evil intent attack me, my ears will hear.
92.12: The righteous will flourish like palm trees; they will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
92.13: Planted in the LORD's Temple, they will flourish in the courtyard of our God.
92.14: They will still bear fruit even in old age; they will be luxuriant and green.
92.15: They will proclaim: "The LORD is upright; my rock, in whom there is no injustice."

93.1: The LORD reigns! He is clothed in majesty; the LORD is clothed, and he is girded with strength. Indeed, the world is well established, and cannot be shaken.
93.2: Your throne has been established since time immemorial; you are king from eternity.
93.3: The rivers have flooded, LORD; the rivers have spoken aloud, the rivers have lifted up their crushing waves.
93.4: More than the sound of surging waters— the majestic waves of the sea— the LORD on high is majestic.
93.5: Your decrees are very trustworthy, and holiness always befits your house, LORD.

94.1: God of vengeance, LORD God of vengeance, display your splendor!
94.2: Stand up, judge of the earth, and repay the proud.
94.3: How long will the wicked, LORD, how long will the wicked continue to triumph?
94.4: When they speak, they spew arrogance. Everyone who practices iniquity brags about it.
94.5: LORD, they have crushed your people, afflicting your heritage.
94.6: The wicked kill widows and foreigners; they murder orphans.
94.7: They say, "The LORD cannot see, and the God of Jacob will not notice."
94.8: Pay attention, you dull ones among the crowds! You fools! Will you ever become wise?
94.9: The one who formed the ear can hear, can he not? The one who made the eyes can see, can he not?
94.10: The one who disciplines nations can rebuke them, can he not? The one who teaches mankind can discern, can he not?
94.11: The LORD knows the thoughts of human beings— that they are futile.
94.12: How blessed is the man whom you instruct, LORD, whom you teach from your Law,
94.13: keeping him calm when times are troubled until a pit has been dug for the wicked.
94.14: For the LORD will not forsake his people; he will not abandon his heritage.
94.15: Righteousness will be restored with justice, and all the pure of heart will follow it.
94.16: Who will rise up for me against the wicked? Who will stand for me against those who practice iniquity?
94.17: If the LORD had not been my helper, I would have quickly become silent.
94.18: When I say that my foot is shaking, your gracious love, LORD, will sustain me.
94.19: When my anxious inner thoughts become overwhelming, your comfort encourages me.
94.20: Will destructive national leaders, who plan wicked things through misuse of the Law, be allied with you?
94.21: They gather together against the righteous, condemning the innocent to death.
94.22: But the LORD is my stronghold, and my God, the rock, is my refuge.
94.23: He will repay them for their sin; he will annihilate them because of their evil. The LORD our God will annihilate them.

95.1: Come! Let us sing joyfully to the LORD! Let us shout for joy to the rock of our salvation.
95.2: Let us come into his presence with thanksgiving; let us shout with songs of praise to him.
95.3: For the LORD is an awesome God; a great king above all divine beings.
95.4: He holds in his hand the lowest parts of the earth and the mountain peaks belong to him.
95.5: The sea that he made belongs to him, along with the dry land that his hands formed.
95.6: Come! Let us worship and bow down; let us kneel in the presence of the LORD, who made us.
95.7: For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture and the flock in his care. If only you would listen to his voice today,
95.8: do not be stubborn like your ancestors were at Meribah, as on that day at Massah, in the wilderness,
95.9: where your ancestors tested me. They tested me, even though they had seen my awesome deeds.
95.10: For forty years I loathed that generation, so I said, "They are a people whose hearts continuously err, and they have not understood my ways."
95.11: So in my anger I declared an oath: "They are not to enter my place of rest."

96.1: Sing a new song to the LORD! Sing to the LORD, all the earth!
96.2: Sing to the LORD! Bless his name! Proclaim his deliverance every day!
96.3: Declare his glory among the nations and his awesome deeds among all the peoples!
96.4: For the LORD is great, and greatly to be praised; he is awesome above all gods.
96.5: For all the gods of the peoples are worthless idols, but the LORD made the heavens.
96.6: Splendor and majesty are before him; might and beauty are in his sanctuary.
96.7: Ascribe to the LORD, you families of peoples, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength!
96.8: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due his name, bring an offering and enter his courts!
96.9: Worship the LORD in holy splendor; tremble before him, all the earth.
96.10: Declare among the nations, "The LORD reigns!" Indeed, he established the world so that it will not falter. He will judge people fairly.
96.11: The heavens will be glad and the earth will rejoice; even the sea and everything that fills it will roar.
96.12: The field and all that is in it will rejoice; then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy
96.13: in the LORD's presence, because he is coming; indeed, he will come to judge the earth. He will judge the world fairly and its people reliably.

97.1: The LORD reigns! Let the earth rejoice! May many islands be glad!
97.2: Thick clouds are all around him; righteousness and justice are his throne's foundation.
97.3: Fire goes out from his presence to consume his enemies on every side.
97.4: His lightning bolts light the world; the earth sees and shakes.
97.5: Mountains melt like wax in the LORD's presence— In the presence of the LORD of all the earth.
97.6: The heavens declare his righteousness so that all the nations see his glory.
97.7: All who serve carved images— and those who praise idols—will be humiliated. Worship him, all you "gods"!
97.8: Zion hears and rejoices; the towns of Judah rejoice on account of your justice, LORD.
97.9: For you, LORD, are the Most High above all the earth; you are exalted high above all divine beings.
97.10: Hate evil, you who love the LORD! He guards the lives of those who love him, delivering them from domination by the wicked.
97.11: Light shines on the righteous; gladness on the morally upright.
97.12: Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous ones! Give thanks at the mention of his holiness!

98.1: Sing to the LORD a new song, for he has done awesome deeds! His right hand and powerful arm have brought him victory.
98.2: The LORD has made his deliverance known; he has disclosed his justice before the nations.
98.3: He has remembered his gracious love; his faithfulness toward the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth saw our God's deliverance.
98.4: Make a joyful noise to the LORD, all the earth! Break forth into joyful songs of praise!
98.5: Sing praises to the LORD with a lyre— with a lyre and a melodious song!
98.6: With trumpets and the sound of a ram's horn shout in the presence of the LORD, the king!
98.7: Let the sea and everything in it shout, along with the world and its inhabitants;
98.8: let the rivers clap their hands in unison; and let the mountains sing for joy
98.9: in the LORD's presence, who comes to judge the earth; He'll judge the world righteously; and its people fairly.

99.1: The LORD reigns— let people tremble; he is seated above the cherubim— let the earth quake.
99.2: The LORD is great in Zion and is exalted above all peoples.
99.3: Let them praise your great and awesome name. He is holy!
99.4: A mighty king who loves justice, you have established fairness. You have exercised justice and righteousness over Jacob.
99.5: Exalt the LORD our God; worship and bow down at his footstool; He is holy!
99.6: Moses and Aaron were among his priests; Samuel also was among those who invoked his name. When they called on the LORD, he answered them.
99.7: In a pillar of cloud he spoke to them; they obeyed his decrees and the Law that he gave them.
99.8: LORD our God, you answered them; you were their God who forgave them, but also avenged their evil deeds.
99.9: Exalt the LORD our God and worship at his holy mountain, for the LORD our God is holy!

100.1: Shout to the LORD all the earth!
100.2: Serve the LORD with joy. Come before him with a joyful shout!
100.3: Acknowledge that the LORD is God. He made us and we belong to him; we are his people and the sheep of his pasture.
100.4: Enter his gates with thanksgiving and his courts with praise. Thank him and bless his name,
100.5: for the LORD is good and his gracious love stands forever. His faithfulness remains from generation to generation.

101.1: I will sing about gracious love and justice; LORD, I will sing praise to you.
101.2: I will pay attention to living a life of integrity— when will I attain it? I will live with integrity of heart in my house.
101.3: I will not even think about doing anything lawless; I hate to do evil deeds; I will have none of it.
101.4: I will not allow anyone with a perverted mind in my presence; I will not be involved with anything evil.
101.5: I will destroy the one who secretly slanders a friend. I will not allow the proud and haughty to prevail.
101.6: My eyes are looking at the faithful of the land, so they may live with me; The one who lives a life of integrity will serve me.
101.7: A deceitful person will not sit in my house; A liar will not remain in my presence.
101.8: Every morning I will destroy all the wicked of the land, eliminating everyone who practices iniquity from the LORD's city.

102.1: LORD, hear my prayer! May my cry for help come to you.
102.2: Do not hide your face from me when I am in trouble. Listen to me. When I call to out you, hurry to answer me!
102.3: For my days are vanishing like smoke; my bones are charred as in a fireplace.
102.4: Withered like grass, my heart is overwhelmed, and I have even forgotten to eat my food.
102.5: Because of the sound of my sighing, my bones cling to my skin.
102.6: I resemble a pelican in the wilderness or an owl in a desolate land.
102.7: I lie awake, yet I am like a bird isolated on a rooftop.
102.8: My enemies revile me all day long; those who ridicule me use my name to curse.
102.9: I have eaten ashes as food and mixed my drink with tears
102.10: because of your indignation and wrath, when you lifted and threw me away.
102.11: My life is like a declining shadow, and I am withering like a plant.
102.12: But you, LORD, are enthroned forever; You are remembered throughout all generations.
102.13: You will arise to extend compassion on Zion, for it is time to show her favor— the appointed time has come.
102.14: Your servants take pleasure in its stones and delight in its debris.
102.15: Nations will fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth, your splendor.
102.16: When the LORD rebuilds Zion, he will appear in his glory.
102.17: He will turn to the prayer of the destitute, not despising their prayer.
102.18: Write this for the next generation, that a people yet to be created will praise the LORD.
102.19: For when he looked down from his holy heights— the LORD looked over the earth from heaven—
102.20: to listen to the groans of prisoners, to set free those condemned to death,
102.21: so they would declare the name of the LORD in Zion and his praise in Jerusalem,
102.22: when people and kingdoms gather together to serve the LORD.
102.23: He has weakened my strength along the way. He has cut short my days.
102.24: I say, "My God, whose years continue through all generations, do not take me in the middle of my life.
102.25: You established the earth long ago; the heavens are the work of your hands.
102.26: They will perish, but you will remain; and they all will become worn out, like a garment. You will change them like clothing, and they will pass away.
102.27: But you remain the same; your years never end.
102.28: May the descendants of your servants live securely, and may their children be established in your presence."

103.1: Bless the LORD, my soul, and all that is within me, bless his holy name.
103.2: Bless the LORD, my soul, and never forget any of his benefits:
103.3: He continues to forgive all your sins, he continues to heal all your diseases,
103.4: he continues to redeem your life from the Pit, and he continuously surrounds you with gracious love and compassion.
103.5: He keeps satisfying you with good things, and he keeps renewing your youth like the eagle's.
103.6: The LORD continuously does what is right, executing justice for all who are being oppressed.
103.7: He revealed his plans to Moses and his deeds to the people of Israel.
103.8: The LORD is compassionate and gracious, patient, and abundantly rich in gracious love.
103.9: He does not maintain a dispute continuously or remain angry for all time.
103.10: He neither deals with us according to our sins, nor repays us equivalent to our iniquity.
103.11: As high as heaven rises above earth, so his gracious love strengthens those who fear him.
103.12: As distant as the east is from the west, that is how far he has removed our sins from us.
103.13: As a father has compassion for his children, so the LORD has compassion for those who fear him.
103.14: For he knows how we were formed, aware that we were made from dust.
103.15: A person's life is like grass— it blossoms like wild flowers,
103.16: but when the wind blows through it, it withers away and no one remembers where it was.
103.17: Yet the LORD's gracious love remains throughout eternity for those who fear him and his righteous acts extend to their children's children,
103.18: to those who keep his covenant and to those who remember to observe his precepts.
103.19: The LORD has established his throne in heaven and his kingdom rules over all.
103.20: Bless the LORD, you angels who belong to him, you mighty warriors who carry out his commands, who are obedient to the sound of his words.
103.21: Bless the LORD, all his heavenly armies, his ministers who do his will.
103.22: Bless the LORD, all his creation, in all the places of his dominion. Bless the LORD, my soul.

104.1: Bless the LORD, my soul; LORD, my God, you are very great. You are clothed in splendor and majesty;
104.2: you are wrapped in light like a garment, stretching out the sky like a curtain.
104.3: He lays the beams of his roof loft on the water above, making clouds his chariot, walking on the wings of the wind.
104.4: He makes the winds his messengers, blazing fires his servants.
104.5: He established the earth on its foundations, so that it never falters.
104.6: You covered the primeval ocean like a garment; the water stood above the mountains.
104.7: They flee at your rebuke; they rush away at the sound of your thunders.
104.8: Mountains rise up and valleys sink to the place you have ordained for them.
104.9: You have set a boundary they cannot cross; they will never again cover the earth.
104.10: He causes springs to gush forth into rivers that flow between the mountains.
104.11: They give water for animals of the field to drink; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
104.12: Birds of the sky live beside them and chirp a song among the foliage.
104.13: He waters the mountains from his heavenly rooms; the earth is satisfied from the fruit of your work.
104.14: He causes grass to sprout for the cattle and plants for people to cultivate, to produce food from the land,
104.15: like wine that makes the heart of people happy, oil that makes the face glow, and food that sustains people.
104.16: The loftiest trees are satisfied, the cedars of Lebanon that he planted,
104.17: the birds build their nests there, and the heron builds its nest among the evergreen.
104.18: The high mountains are for wild goats; the cliffs are a refuge for the rock badger.
104.19: He made the moon to mark time; the sun knows its setting time.
104.20: You bring darkness and it becomes night; when every beast of the forest prowls.
104.21: Young lions roar for prey, seeking their food from God.
104.22: When the sun rises, they gather and lie down in their dens.
104.23: People go out to their work and labor until evening.
104.24: How numerous are your works, LORD! You have made them all wisely; the earth is filled with your creations.
104.25: There is the deep and wide sea, teeming with numberless creatures, living things small and great.
104.26: There, the ships pass through; Leviathan, which you created, frolics in it.
104.27: All of them look to you to provide them their food at the proper time.
104.28: They receive what you give them; when you open your hand, they are filled with good things.
104.29: When you withdraw your favor, they are disappointed; Take away their breath, and they die and return to dust.
104.30: When you send your spirit, they are created, and you replenish the surface of the earth.
104.31: May the glory of the LORD last forever; may the LORD rejoice in his works!
104.32: He looks at the earth and it shakes; he touches the mountains and they smoke.
104.33: I will sing to the LORD with my whole being; I will sing to my God continually!
104.34: May my thoughts be pleasing to him; indeed, I will rejoice in the LORD!
104.35: May sinners disappear from the land and the wicked live no longer. Bless the LORD, my soul! Hallelujah!

105.1: Give thanks to the LORD, call on his name, and make his deeds known among the people.
105.2: Sing to him! Praise him! Declare all his awesome deeds!
105.3: Exult in his holy name; let all those who seek the LORD rejoice!
105.4: Seek the LORD and his strength; seek his face continually.
105.5: Remember his awesome deeds that he has done, his wonders and the judgments he declared.
105.6: You descendants of Abraham, his servant, You children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
105.7: He is the LORD our God; his judgments extend to the entire earth.
105.8: He remembers his eternal covenant— every promise he made for a thousand generations,
105.9: like the covenant he made with Abraham, and his promise to Isaac.
105.10: He presented it to Jacob as a decree, to Israel as an everlasting covenant.
105.11: He said: "I will give Canaan to you as the allotted portion that is your inheritance."
105.12: When the Hebrews were few in number—so very few— and were sojourners in it,
105.13: they wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.
105.14: He did not allow anyone to oppress them, or any kings to reprove them.
105.15: "Don't touch my anointed or hurt my prophets!"
105.16: He declared a famine on the land; destroying the entire food supply.
105.17: He sent a man before them— Joseph, who had been sold as a slave.
105.18: They bound his feet with fetters and placed an iron collar on his neck,
105.19: until the time his prediction came true, as the word of the LORD refined him.
105.20: He sent a king who released him, a ruler of people who set him free.
105.21: He made him the master over his household, the manager of all his possessions—
105.22: to discipline his rulers at will and make his elders wise.
105.23: Then Israel came to Egypt; indeed, Jacob lived in the land of Ham.
105.24: He caused his people to multiply greatly; and be more numerous than their enemies.
105.25: He caused them to hate his people and to deceive his servants.
105.26: He sent his servant Moses, along with Aaron, whom he had chosen.
105.27: They performed his signs among them, his wonders in the land of Ham.
105.28: He sent darkness, and it became dark. Did they not rebel against his words?
105.29: He turned their water into blood, so that the fish died.
105.30: Their land swarmed with frogs even to the chambers of their kings.
105.31: He spoke, and a swarm of insects invaded their land.
105.32: He sent hail instead of rain, and lightning throughout their land.
105.33: It destroyed their vines and their figs, breaking trees throughout their country.
105.34: Then he commanded the locust to come— grasshoppers without number.
105.35: They consumed every green plant in their land, and devoured the fruit of their soil.
105.36: He struck down every firstborn in their land, the first fruits of all their progeny.
105.37: Then he brought Israel out with silver and gold, and no one among his tribes stumbled.
105.38: The Egyptians rejoiced when they left, because fear of Israel descended on them.
105.39: He spread out a cloud for a cover, and fire for light at night.
105.40: Israel asked, and quail came; food from heaven satisfied them.
105.41: He opened a rock, and water gushed out flowing like a river in the desert.
105.42: Indeed, he remembered his sacred promise to his servant Abraham.
105.43: He led his people out with gladness, his chosen ones with shouts of joy.
105.44: He gave to them the land of nations; they inherited the labor of other people
105.45: so they might keep his statutes and observe his laws. Hallelujah!

106.1: Hallelujah! Give thanks to the LORD, since he is good, for his gracious love exists forever.
106.2: Who can fully describe the mighty acts of the LORD or proclaim all his praises?
106.3: How happy are those who enforce justice, who live righteously all the time.
106.4: Remember me, LORD, when you show favor to your people. Visit us with your deliverance,
106.5: to witness the prosperity of your chosen ones, to rejoice in your nation's joy, to glory in your inheritance.
106.6: We have sinned, along with our ancestors; we have committed iniquity and wickedness.
106.7: In Egypt, our ancestors neither comprehended your awesome deeds nor remembered your abundant gracious love. Instead, they rebelled beside the sea, the Reed Sea.
106.8: He delivered for the sake of his name, to make his power known.
106.9: He shouted at the Reed Sea and it dried up; and led them through the sea as though through a desert.
106.10: He delivered them from the power of their foe; redeeming them from the power of their enemy.
106.11: The water overwhelmed their enemies, so that not one of them survived.
106.12: Then they believed his word and sung his praise.
106.13: But they quickly forgot his deeds and did not wait for his counsel.
106.14: They were overwhelmed with craving in the wilderness, so God tested them in the wasteland.
106.15: God granted them their request, but sent leanness into their lives.
106.16: They were envious of Moses in the camp, and of Aaron, the holy one of the LORD.
106.17: The earth opened and swallowed Dathan, closing over Abiram's clan.
106.18: Then a fire burned among their company, a flame that set the wicked ablaze.
106.19: They fashioned a calf at Horeb and worshipped a carved image.
106.20: They exchanged their glory with the image of a grass-eating bull.
106.21: They forgot God their Savior, who performed great things in Egypt—
106.22: awesome deeds in the land of Ham, astonishing deeds at the Reed Sea.
106.23: He would have destroyed them but for Moses, his chosen one, who stood in the breach before him to avert his destructive wrath.
106.24: They rejected the desirable land, and they didn't trust his promise.
106.25: They murmured in their tents, and didn't listen to the voice of the LORD.
106.26: So he swore an oath concerning them— that he would cause them to die in the wilderness,
106.27: to cause their children to perish among the nations and be scattered among many lands.
106.28: For they adopted the worship of Baal Peor and ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
106.29: They had provoked anger by their deeds, so that a plague broke out against them.
106.30: But Phinehas intervened and prayed so that the plague was restrained.
106.31: And it was credited to him as a righteous act, from generation to generation—to eternity.
106.32: They provoked wrath at the waters of Meribah, and Moses suffered on account of them.
106.33: For they rebelled against him, so that he spoke thoughtlessly with his lips.
106.34: They never destroyed the people, as the LORD had commanded them.
106.35: Instead, they mingled among the nations and learned their ways.
106.36: They worshipped their idols, and this became a trap for them.
106.37: They sacrificed their sons and daughters to demons.
106.38: They shed innocent blood— the blood of their sons and daughters— whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, thereby polluting the land with blood.
106.39: Therefore, they became unclean because of what they did; they have acted like whores by their evil deeds.
106.40: The LORD's anger burned against his people, so that he despised his own inheritance.
106.41: He turned them over to domination by nations where those who hated them ruled over them.
106.42: Their enemies oppressed them, so that they were humiliated by their power.
106.43: He delivered them many times, but they demonstrated rebellion by their evil plans; therefore they sunk deep in their sins.
106.44: Yet when he saw their distress and heard their cries for help,
106.45: he remembered his covenant with them, and so relented according to the greatness of his gracious love.
106.46: He caused all their captors to show compassion toward them.
106.47: Deliver us, LORD our God, gather us from among the nations so we may praise your holy name and rejoice in praising you.
106.48: Blessed are you, LORD God of Israel, from eternity to eternity; Let all the people say, "Amen!" Hallelujah!

107.1: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good! His gracious love exists forever.
107.2: Let those who have been redeemed by the LORD declare it— those whom he redeemed from the power of the enemy,
107.3: those whom he gathered from other lands— from the east, west, north, and south.
107.4: They wandered in desolate wilderness; they found no road to a city where they could live.
107.5: Hungry and thirsty, their spirits failed.
107.6: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them from their distress.
107.7: He led them in a straight way to find a city where they could live.
107.8: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his gracious love and his awesome deeds for mankind.
107.9: He has satisfied the one who thirsts, filling the hungry with what is good.
107.10: Some sat in deepest darkness, shackled with cruel iron,
107.11: because they had rebelled against the command of God, despising the advice of the Most High.
107.12: He humbled them through suffering, as they stumbled without a helper.
107.13: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble; he delivered them from their distress.
107.14: And he brought them out from darkness and the shadow of death, shattering their chains.
107.15: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his gracious love, and for his awesome deeds to mankind.
107.16: For he shattered bronze gates and cut through iron bars.
107.17: Because of their rebellious ways, fools suffered for their iniquities.
107.18: They loathed all food, and even reached the gates of death.
107.19: Yet when they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, he delivered them from certain destruction.
107.20: He issued his command and healed them; he delivered them from their destruction.
107.21: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his gracious love, and for his awesome deeds for mankind.
107.22: Let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving and talk about his works with shouts of joy.
107.23: Those who go down to the sea in ships, who work in the great waters,
107.24: witnessed the works of the LORD— his awesome deeds in the ocean's depth.
107.25: He spoke and stirred up a windstorm that made its waves surge.
107.26: The people ascended skyward and descended to the depths, their courage melting away in their peril.
107.27: They reeled and staggered like a drunkard, as all their wisdom became useless.
107.28: Yet when they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, the LORD brought them out of their distress.
107.29: He calmed the storm and its waves quieted down.
107.30: So they rejoiced that the waves became quiet, and he led them to their desired haven.
107.31: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his gracious love and for his awesome deeds on behalf of mankind.
107.32: Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people and praise him in the counsel of the elders.
107.33: He turns rivers into a desert, springs of water into dry ground,
107.34: and a fruitful land into a salty waste, due to the wickedness of its inhabitants.
107.35: He turns a desert into a pool of water, dry land into springs of water.
107.36: There he settled the hungry, where they built a city to live in.
107.37: They sowed fields and planted vineyards that yielded a productive harvest.
107.38: Then he blessed them, and they became numerous; he multiplied their cattle.
107.39: But they became few in number, and humiliated by continued oppression, agony, and sorrow.
107.40: Having poured contempt on their nobles, causing them to err aimlessly in the way.
107.41: Yet he lifted the needy from affliction and made them families like a flock.
107.42: The upright see it and rejoice, but the mouth of an evil person is shut.
107.43: Let whoever is wise observe these things, that they may comprehend the gracious love of the LORD.

108.1: My heart is firm, God; I will sing and praise you with my whole being.
108.2: Awake, harp and lyre! I will wake up at dawn.
108.3: I will give thanks to you among the peoples, LORD! I will sing praise to you among the nations.
108.4: For your gracious love extends to the sky, and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
108.5: May you be exalted above the heavens, God, and your glory be over all the earth.
108.6: In order that those you love may be rescued, deliver with your power and answer me!
108.7: God had promised in his sanctuary: "I will triumph and divide Shechem, then I will measure the valley of Succoth!
108.8: Gilead and Manasseh belong to me, while Ephraim is my chief stronghold and Judah is my scepter.
108.9: Moab is my washbasin; I will fling my shoe on Edom and shout over Philistia."
108.10: Who will lead me to the fortified city? Who will lead me as far as Edom?
108.11: God, you have rejected us, have you not, since you did not march out with our army, God?
108.12: Give us help against the enemy, because human help is useless.
108.13: I will find strength in God, for he will trample on our foes.

109.1: God, whom I praise, do not be silent,
109.2: for the mouths of wicked and deceitful people are opened against me; they speak against me with lying tongues.
109.3: They surround me with hate-filled words, attacking me for no reason.
109.4: Instead of receiving my love, they accuse me, though I continue in prayer.
109.5: They devise evil against me instead of good, and hatred in place of my love.
109.6: Appoint an evil person over him; may an accuser stand at his right side.
109.7: When he is judged, may he be found guilty; may his prayer be regarded as sin.
109.8: May his days be few; may another take over his position.
109.9: May his children become fatherless, and his wife a widow.
109.10: May his children roam around begging, seeking food while driven far from their ruined homes.
109.11: May creditors seize all his possessions, and may foreigners loot the property he has acquired.
109.12: May no one extend gracious love to him, or show favor to his fatherless children.
109.13: May his descendants be eliminated, and their memory be erased from the next generation.
109.14: May his ancestors' guilt be remembered in the LORD's presence, and may his mother's guilt not be erased.
109.15: May what they have done be continually in the LORD's presence; and may their memory be excised from the earth.
109.16: For he didn't think to extend gracious love; he harassed to death the poor, the needy, and the broken hearted.
109.17: He loved to curse—may his curses return upon him! He took no delight in blessing others — so may blessings be far from him.
109.18: He wore curses like a garment— may they enter his inner being like water and his bones like oil.
109.19: May those curses wrap around him like a garment, or like a belt that one always wears.
109.20: May this be the way the LORD repays my accuser, those who speak evil against me.
109.21: Now you, LORD my God, defend me for your name's sake; because your gracious love is good, deliver me!
109.22: Indeed, I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
109.23: I am fading away like a shadow late in the day; I am shaken off like a locust.
109.24: My knees give way from fasting, and my skin is lean, deprived of oil.
109.25: I have become an object of derision to them— they shake their heads whenever they see me.
109.26: Help me, LORD my God! Deliver me in accord with your gracious love!
109.27: Then they will realize that your hand is in this— that you, LORD, have accomplished it.
109.28: They will curse, but you will bless. When they attack, they will be humiliated, while your servant rejoices.
109.29: May my accusers be clothed with shame and wrapped in their humiliation as with a robe.
109.30: I will give many thanks to the LORD with my mouth, praising him publicly,
109.31: for he stands at the right hand of the needy one, to deliver him from his accusers.

110.1: A declaration from the LORD to my Lord: "Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies your footstool."
110.2: When the LORD extends your mighty scepter from Zion, rule in the midst of your enemies.
110.3: Your soldiers are willing volunteers on your day of battle; in majestic holiness, from the womb, from the dawn, the dew of your youth belongs to you.
110.4: The LORD took an oath and will never recant: "You are a priest forever, after the manner of Melchizedek."
110.5: The Lord is at your right hand; he will utterly destroy kings in the time of his wrath.
110.6: He will execute judgment against the nations, filling graves with corpses. He will utterly destroy leaders far and wide.
110.7: He will drink from a stream on the way, then hold his head high.

111.1: Hallelujah! I will give thanks to the LORD with all of my heart in the assembled congregation of the upright.
111.2: Great are the acts of the LORD; they are within reach of all who desire them.
111.3: Splendid and glorious are his awesome deeds, and his righteousness endures forever.
111.4: He is remembered for his awesome deeds; the LORD is gracious and compassionate.
111.5: He prepares food for those who fear him; he is ever mindful of his covenant.
111.6: He revealed his mighty deeds to his people by giving them a country of their own.
111.7: Whatever he does is reliable and just, and all his precepts are trustworthy,
111.8: sustained through all eternity, and fashioned in both truth and righteousness.
111.9: He sent deliverance to his people; he ordained his covenant to last forever; his name is holy and awesome.
