111.10: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; sound understanding belongs to those who practice it. Praise of God endures forever.

112.1: Hallelujah! How happy is the person who fears the LORD, who truly delights in his commandments.
112.2: His descendants will be powerful in the land, a generation of the upright who will be blessed.
112.3: Wealth and riches are in his house, and his righteousness endures forever.
112.4: A light shines in the darkness for the upright, for the one who is gracious, compassionate, and just.
112.5: It is good for the person who lends generously, conducting his affairs with fairness.
112.6: He will never be shaken; the one who is just will always be remembered.
112.7: He need not fear a bad report, for his heart is unshaken, since he trusts in the LORD.
112.8: His heart is steadfast, he will not fear. In the end he will look in triumph over his enemy.
112.9: He gives generously to the poor; his righteousness endures forever; his horn is exalted in honor.
112.10: The wicked person sees this and flies into a rage; his teeth gnash and wear away. The desire of the wicked will amount to nothing.

113.1: Hallelujah! Give praise, you servants of the LORD. Praise the name of the LORD!
113.2: May the name of the LORD be blessed from now to eternity.
113.3: From rising to setting sun, may the name of the LORD be praised.
113.4: The LORD is exalted high above all the nations; his glory beyond the heavens.
113.5: Who is like the LORD our God, enthroned on high,
113.6: yet stooping low to observe the sky and the earth?
113.7: He lifts the poor person from the dust, raising the needy from the trash pile
113.8: and giving him a seat among nobles— with the nobles of his people.
113.9: He makes the barren woman among her household a happy mother of joyful children. Hallelujah!

114.1: When Israel came out of Egypt— the household of Jacob from a people of foreign speech—
114.2: Judah became his sanctuary and Israel his place of dominion.
114.3: The sea saw this and fled, the Jordan River ran backwards,
114.4: the mountains skipped like rams, and the hills like lambs.
114.5: What happened to you, sea, that you fled? Jordan, that you ran backwards?
114.6: Mountains, that you skipped like rams? and you hills, that you skipped like lambs?
114.7: Tremble then, earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
114.8: who turned the rock into a pool of water, the flinty rock into flowing springs.

115.1: Not to us, LORD, not to us, but to your name be given glory on account of your gracious love and faithfulness.
115.2: Why should the nations ask "Where now is their God?"
115.3: when our God is in the heavens and he does whatever he desires?
115.4: Their idols are silver and gold, crafted by human hands.
115.5: They have mouths, but cannot speak; they have eyes, but cannot see.
115.6: They have ears, but cannot hear; they have noses, but cannot smell.
115.7: They have hands, but cannot touch; feet, but cannot walk; they cannot even groan with their throats.
115.8: Those who craft them will become like them, as will all those who trust in them.
115.9: Israel, trust in the LORD! He is their helper and shield.
115.10: House of Aaron, trust in the LORD! He is their helper and shield.
115.11: You who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD! He is their helper and shield.
115.12: The LORD remembers and blesses us. He will indeed bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.
115.13: He will bless those who fear the LORD, both the important and the insignificant together.
115.14: May the LORD add to your numbers— to you and to your descendants.
115.15: May you be blessed by the LORD, who made the heavens and the earth.
115.16: The highest heavens belong to the LORD, but he gave the earth to human beings.
115.17: Neither can the dead praise the LORD, nor those who go down into the silence of death.
115.18: But we will bless the LORD from now to eternity. Hallelujah!

116.1: I love the LORD because he has heard my prayer for mercy;
116.2: for he listens to me whenever I call.
116.3: The ropes of death were wound around me and the anguish of Sheol came upon me; I encountered distress and sorrow.
116.4: Then I called on the name of the LORD, "LORD, please deliver me!"
116.5: The LORD is gracious and righteous; our God is compassionate;
116.6: the LORD watches over the innocent; I was brought low, and he delivered me.
116.7: Return to your resting place, my soul, for the LORD treated you generously.
116.8: Indeed, you delivered my soul from death, my eyes from crying, and my feet from stumbling.
116.9: I will walk in the LORD's presence in the lands of the living.
116.10: I will continue to believe, even when I say, "I am greatly afflicted"
116.11: and speak hastily, "All people are liars!"
116.12: What will I return to the LORD for all his benefits to me?
116.13: I will raise my cup of deliverance and invoke the LORD's name.
116.14: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all his people.
116.15: In the sight of the LORD, the death of his faithful ones is valued.
116.16: LORD, I am indeed your servant. I am your servant. I am the son of your handmaid. You have released my bonds.
116.17: I will bring you a thanksgiving offering and call on the name of the LORD!
116.18: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all his people,
116.19: in the courts of the LORD's house, in your midst, Jerusalem. Hallelujah!

117.1: Praise the LORD, all you nations! Exalt him, all you peoples!
117.2: For great is his gracious love toward us, and the LORD's faithfulness is eternal. Hallelujah!

118.1: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his gracious love is eternal.
118.2: Let Israel now say, "His gracious love is eternal."
118.3: Let the house of Aaron now say, "His gracious love is eternal."
118.4: Let those who fear the LORD now say, "His gracious love is eternal."
118.5: I called on the LORD in my distress; the LORD answered me openly.
118.6: The LORD is with me. I will not be afraid. What can people do to me?
118.7: With the LORD beside me as my helper, I will triumph over those who hate me.
118.8: It is better to take shelter in the LORD than to trust in people.
118.9: It is better to take shelter in the LORD than to trust in princes.
118.10: All the nations surrounded me; but in the name of the LORD I will defeat them.
118.11: They surrounded me, they are around me; but in the name of the LORD I will defeat them.
118.12: They surrounded me like bees; but they will be extinguished like burning thorns. In the name of the LORD I will defeat them.
118.13: Indeed, you oppressed me so much that I nearly fell, but the LORD helped me.
118.14: The LORD is my strength and protector, for he has become my deliverer.
118.15: There's exultation for deliverance in the tents of the righteous: "The right hand of the LORD is victorious!
118.16: The right hand of the LORD is exalted! The right hand of the LORD is victorious!"
118.17: I will not die, but I will live to recount the deeds of the LORD.
118.18: The LORD will discipline me severely, but he won't hand me over to die.
118.19: Open for me the righteous gates so I may enter through them to give thanks to the LORD.
118.20: This is the LORD's gate— The righteous will enter through it.
118.21: I will praise you because you have answered me and have become my deliverer.
118.22: The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
118.23: This is from the LORD— it is awesome in our sight.
118.24: This is the day that the LORD has made; let's rejoice and be glad in it.
118.25: Please LORD, deliver us! Please LORD, hurry and bring success now!
118.26: Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the LORD! Let us bless you from the LORD's house.
118.27: The LORD is God—he will be our light! Bind the festival sacrifice with ropes to the horn at the altar.
118.28: You are my God, and I will praise you; my God, and I will exalt you.
118.29: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good and his gracious love is eternal.

119.1: How blessed are those whose life is blameless, who walk in the Law of the LORD!
119.2: How blessed are those who observe his decrees, who seek him with all of their heart,
119.3: who practice no evil while they walk in his ways.
119.4: You have commanded concerning your precepts, that they be guarded with diligence.
119.5: Oh, that my ways were steadfast, so I may keep your statutes.
119.6: Then I will not be ashamed, since my eyes will be fixed on all of your commands.
119.7: I will praise you with an upright heart, as I learn your righteous decrees.
119.8: I will keep your statutes; do not ever abandon me.
119.9: How can a young man keep his behavior pure? By guarding it in accordance with your word.
119.10: I have sought you with all of my heart; do not let me drift away from your commands.
119.11: I have stored what you have said in my heart, so I won't sin against you.
119.12: Blessed are you, LORD! Teach me your statutes.
119.13: I have spoken with my lips about all your decrees that you have announced.
119.14: I find joy in the path of your decrees, as if I owned all kinds of riches.
119.15: I will meditate on your precepts, and I will respect your ways.
119.16: I am delighted with your statutes; I will not forget your word.
119.17: Deal kindly with your servant so I may live and keep your word.
119.18: Open my eyes so that I will observe amazing things from your instruction.
119.19: Since I am a stranger on the earth, do not hide your commands from me.
119.20: My soul is consumed with longing for your decrees at all times.
119.21: You rebuke the accursed ones, who wander from your commands.
119.22: Remove scorn and disrespect from me, for I observe your decrees.
119.23: Though nobles take their seat and gossip about me, your servant will meditate on your statutes.
119.24: I take joy in your decrees, for they are my counselors.
119.25: My soul clings to the dust; revive me according to your word.
119.26: I have talked about my ways, and you have answered me; Teach me your statutes.
119.27: Help me understand how your precepts function, and I will meditate on your wondrous acts.
119.28: I weep because of sorrow; fortify me according to your word.
119.29: Remove false paths from me; and graciously give me your instruction.
119.30: I have chosen the faithful way; I have firmly placed your ordinances before me.
119.31: I cling to your decrees; LORD, do not put me to shame.
119.32: I eagerly race along the way of your commands, for you enable me to do so.
119.33: Teach me, LORD, about the way of your statutes, and I will observe them without fail.
119.34: Give me understanding and I will observe your instruction. I will keep it with all of my heart.
119.35: Help me live my life by your commands, because my joy is in them.
119.36: Turn my heart to your decrees and away from unjust gain.
119.37: Turn my eyes away from gazing at worthless things, and revive me by your ways.
119.38: Confirm your promise to your servant, which is for those who fear you.
119.39: Turn away the shame that I dread, because your ordinances are good.
119.40: Look, I long for your precepts; revive me through your righteousness.
119.41: May your gracious love come to me, LORD, your salvation, just as you said.
119.42: Then I can answer the one who insults me, for I place my trust in your word.
119.43: Never take your truthful words from me, For I wait for your ordinances.
119.44: Then I will always keep your Law, forever and ever,
119.45: I will walk in liberty, for I seek your precepts.
119.46: Then I will speak of your decrees before kings and not be ashamed.
119.47: I will take delight in your commands, which I love.
119.48: I will lift up my hands to your commands, which I love, and I will meditate on your statutes.
119.49: Remember what you said to your servant, by which you caused me to hope.
119.50: This is what comforts me in my troubles: that what you say revives me.
119.51: Even though the arrogant utterly deride me, I do not turn away from your instruction.
119.52: I have remembered your ancient ordinances, LORD, and I take comfort in them.
119.53: I burn with indignation because of the wicked who forsake your instruction.
119.54: Your statutes are my songs, no matter where I make my home.
119.55: In the night I remember your name, LORD, and keep your instruction.
119.56: I have made it my personal responsibility to keep your precepts.
119.57: The LORD is my inheritance; I have given my promise to keep your word.
119.58: I have sought your favor with all of my heart; be gracious to me according to your promise.
119.59: I examined my lifestyle and set my feet in the direction of your decrees.
119.60: I hurried and did not procrastinate to keep your commands.
119.61: Though the ropes of the wicked have ensnared me, I have not forgotten your instruction.
119.62: At midnight I will get up to thank you for your righteous ordinances.
119.63: I am united with all who fear you, and with everyone who keeps your precepts.
119.64: LORD, the earth overflows with your gracious love! Teach me your statutes.
119.65: LORD, you have dealt well with your servant, according to your word.
119.66: Teach me both knowledge and appropriate discretion, because I believe in your commands.
119.67: Before I was humbled, I wandered away, but now I observe your words.
119.68: LORD, you are good , and do what is good; teach me your statutes.
119.69: The arrogant have accused me falsely; but I will observe your precepts wholeheartedly.
119.70: Their minds are clogged as with greasy fat, but I find joy in your instruction.
119.71: It was for my good that I was humbled; so that I would learn your statutes.
119.72: Instruction that comes from you is better for me than thousands of gold and silver coins.
119.73: Your hands made and formed me; give me understanding, that I may learn your commands.
119.74: May those who fear you see me and be glad, for I have hoped in your word.
119.75: I know, LORD, that your decrees are just, and that you have rightfully humbled me.
119.76: May your gracious love comfort me in accordance with your promise to your servant.
119.77: May your mercies come to me that I may live, for your instruction is my delight.
119.78: May the arrogant become ashamed, because they have subverted me with deceit; as for me, I will meditate on your precepts.
119.79: May those who fear you turn to me, along with those who know your decrees.
119.80: May my heart be blameless with respect to your statutes so that I may not become ashamed.
119.81: I long for your deliverance; I have looked to your word, placing my hope in it.
119.82: My eyes grow weary with respect to what you have promised— I keep asking, "When will you comfort me?"
119.83: Though I have become like a water skin dried by smoke, I have not forgotten your statutes.
119.84: How many days must your servant endure this? When will you judge those who persecute me?
119.85: The arrogant have dug pitfalls for me disobeying your instruction.
119.86: All of your commands are reliable. I am persecuted without cause—help me!
119.87: Though the arrogant nearly destroyed me on earth, I did not abandon your precepts.
119.88: Revive me according to your gracious love; and I will keep the decrees that you have proclaimed.
119.89: Your word is forever, LORD; it is firmly established in heaven.
119.90: Your faithfulness continues from generation to generation. You established the earth, and it stands firm.
119.91: To this day they stand by means of your rulings, for all things serve you.
119.92: Had your instruction not been my pleasure, I would have died in my affliction.
119.93: I will never forget your precepts, for you have revived me with them.
119.94: I am yours, so save me, since I have sought your precepts.
119.95: The wicked lay in wait to destroy me, while I ponder your decrees.
119.96: I have observed that all things have their limit, but your commandment is very broad.
119.97: How I love your instruction! Every day it is my meditation.
119.98: Your commands make me wiser than my adversaries, since they are always with me.
119.99: I am more insightful than my teachers, because your decrees are my meditations.
119.100: I have more common sense than the elders, for I observe your precepts.
119.101: I keep away from every evil choice so that I may keep your word.
119.102: I do not avoid your judgments, for you pointed them out to me.
119.103: How pleasing is what you have to say to me— tasting better than honey.
119.104: I obtain understanding from your precepts; therefore I hate every false way.
119.105: Your word is a lamp for my feet, a light for my pathway.
119.106: I have given my word and affirmed it, to keep your righteous judgments.
119.107: I am severely afflicted. Revive me, LORD, according to your word.
119.108: LORD, please accept my voluntary offerings of praise, and teach me your judgments.
119.109: Though I constantly take my life in my hands, I do not forget your instruction.
119.110: Though the wicked lay a trap for me, I haven't wandered away from your precepts.
119.111: I have inherited your decrees forever, because they are the joy of my heart.
119.112: As a result, I am determined to carry out your statutes forever.
119.113: I despise the double-minded, but I love your instruction.
119.114: You are my fortress and shield; I hope in your word.
119.115: Leave me, you who practice evil, that I may observe the commands of my God.
119.116: Sustain me, God, as you have promised, and I will live. Do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
119.117: Support me, that I may be saved, and I will carry out your statutes consistently.
119.118: You reject all who wander from your statutes, since their deceitfulness is vain.
119.119: You remove all the wicked of the earth like dross; therefore I love your decrees.
119.120: My flesh trembles out of fear of you, and I am in awe of your judgments.
119.121: I have acted with justice and righteousness; do not abandon me to my oppressors.
119.122: Back up your servant in a positive way; do not let the arrogant oppress me.
119.123: My eyes fail as I look for your salvation and for your righteous promise.
119.124: Act toward your servant consistent with your gracious love, and teach me your statutes.
119.125: Since I am your servant, give me understanding, so I will know your decrees.
119.126: It is time for the LORD to act, since they have violated your instruction.
119.127: I truly love your commands more than gold, including fine gold.
119.128: I truly consider all of your precepts—all of them—to be just, while I despise every false way.
119.129: Your decrees are wonderful— that's why I observe them.
119.130: The disclosure of your words illuminates, providing understanding to the simple.
119.131: I open my mouth and pant as I long for your commands.
119.132: Turn in my direction and show mercy to me, as you have decreed regarding those who love your name.
119.133: Direct my footsteps by your promise, and do not let any kind of iniquity rule over me.
119.134: Deliver me from human oppression and I will keep your precepts.
119.135: Show favor to your servant, and teach me your statutes.
119.136: My eyes shed rivers of tears, when others do not obey your instruction.
119.137: LORD, you are righteous, and your judgments are right.
119.138: You have ordered your decrees to us rightly, and they are very faithful.
119.139: My zeal consumes me because my enemies forget your words.
119.140: Your word is very pure, and your servant loves it.
119.141: Though I may be small and despised, I do not neglect your precepts.
119.142: Your righteousness is an eternal righteousness, and your instruction is true.
119.143: Though trouble and anguish overwhelm me, your commands remain my delight.
119.144: Your righteous decrees are eternal; give me understanding, and I will live.
119.145: I have cried out with all of my heart. Answer me, LORD! I will observe your statutes.
119.146: I have called out to you, "Save me, so I may keep your decrees."
119.147: I get up before dawn and cry for help; I place my hope in your word.
119.148: I look forward to the night watches, when I may meditate on what you have said.
119.149: Hear my voice according to your gracious love. LORD, revive me in keeping with your justice.
119.150: Those who pursue wickedness draw near; they remain far from your instruction.
119.151: You are near, LORD, and all of your commands are true.
119.152: I discovered long ago about your decrees that you have confirmed them forever.
119.153: Look on my misery, and rescue me, for I do not ignore your instruction.
119.154: Defend my case and redeem me; revive me according to your promise.
119.155: Deliverance remains remote from the wicked, for they do not seek your statutes.
119.156: Your mercies are magnificent, LORD; revive me according to your judgments.
119.157: Though my persecutors and adversaries are numerous, I do not turn aside from your decrees.
119.158: I watch the treacherous, and despise them, because they do not do what you have said.
119.159: Look how I love your precepts, LORD; revive me according to your gracious love.
119.160: The sum of your word is truth, and each righteous ordinance of yours is everlasting.
119.161: Though nobles persecute me for no reason, my heart stands in awe of your words.
119.162: I find joy at what you have said like one who has discovered a great treasure.
119.163: I despise and hate falsehood, but I love your instruction.
119.164: I praise you seven times a day because of your righteous ordinances.
119.165: Great peace belongs to those who love your instruction, and nothing makes them stumble.
119.166: I am looking in hope for your deliverance, LORD, as I carry out your commands.
119.167: My soul treasures your decrees, and I love them deeply.
119.168: I keep your precepts and your decrees because all of my ways are before you.
119.169: May my cry arise before you, LORD; give me understanding according to your word.
119.170: Let my request come before you; deliver me, as you have promised.
119.171: May my lips utter praise, for you teach me your statutes.
119.172: May my tongue sing about your promise, for all of your commands are right.
119.173: May your hand stand ready to assist me, for I have chosen your precepts.
119.174: I am longing for your deliverance, LORD, and your instruction is my joy.
119.175: Let me live, and I will praise you; let your ordinances help me.
119.176: I have wandered away like a lost sheep; come find your servant, for I do not forget your commands.

120.1: I cried to the LORD in my distress, and he responded to me.
120.2: "LORD, deliver me from lips that lie and tongues that deceive."
120.3: What will be given to you, and what will be done to you, you treacherous tongue?
120.4: Like a sharp arrow from a warrior, along with fiery coals from juniper trees!
120.5: How terrible for me, that I am an alien in Meshech, that I reside among the tents of Kedar!
120.6: I have resided too long with those who hate peace.
120.7: I am in favor of peace; but when I speak, they are in favor of war.

121.1: I lift up my eyes toward the mountains— from where will my help come?
121.2: My help is from the LORD, maker of heaven and earth.
121.3: He will never let your foot slip, nor will your guardian become drowsy.
121.4: Look! The one who is guarding Israel never sleeps and does not take naps.
121.5: The LORD is your guardian; the LORD is your shade at your right side.
121.6: The sun will not ravage you by day, nor the moon by night.
121.7: The LORD will guard you from all evil, preserving your life.
121.8: The LORD will guard your goings and comings, from this time on and forever.

122.1: I rejoiced when they kept on asking me, "Let us go to the LORD's Temple."
122.2: Our feet are standing inside your gates, Jerusalem.
122.3: Jerusalem stands built up, a city knitted together.
122.4: To it the tribes ascend— the tribes of the LORD— as decreed to Israel, to give thanks to the name of the LORD.
122.5: For thrones are established there for judgment, thrones of the house of David.
122.6: Pray for peace for Jerusalem: "May those who love you be at peace!
122.7: May peace be within your ramparts, and prosperity within your fortresses."
122.8: For the sake of my relatives and friends I will now say, "May there be peace within you."
122.9: For the sake of the Temple of the LORD our God, I will seek your welfare.

123.1: To you, who sit enthroned in heaven, I lift up my eyes.
123.2: Consider this: as the eyes of a servant focus on what his master provides, and as the eyes of a female servant focus on what her mistress provides, so our eyes focus on the LORD our God, until he has mercy on us.
123.3: Have mercy on us, LORD, have mercy, for we have had more than enough of contempt.
123.4: Our lives overflow with scorn from those who live at ease, with contempt from those who are proud.

124.1: If the LORD had not been on our side— let Israel now say—
124.2: if the LORD had not been on our side, when men came against us,
124.3: then they would have devoured us alive, when their anger burned against us.
124.4: Then the flood waters would have overwhelmed us, the torrent would have flooded over us;
124.5: the swollen waters would have swept us away.
124.6: Blessed be the LORD, who did not give us as prey to their teeth.
124.7: We have escaped like a bird from the hunter's trap. The trap has been broken, and we have escaped.
124.8: Our help is in the name of the LORD, the maker of heaven and earth.

125.1: Those who are trusting in the LORD are like Mount Zion, which cannot be overthrown. They remain forever.
125.2: Just as mountains encircle Jerusalem, so the LORD encircles his people, from now to eternity.
125.3: For evil's scepter will not rest on the land that has been allotted to the righteous, and so the righteous will not direct themselves to do wrong.
125.4: LORD, do good to those who are good, and to those who are upright in heart.
125.5: But for those who choose their own devious paths, the LORD will lead them away, along with those who practice evil. Peace be upon Israel.

126.1: When the LORD brought back Zion's exiles, we were like dreamers.
126.2: Then our mouths were filled with laughter, and our tongues formed joyful shouts. Then it was said among the nations, "The LORD has done great things for them."
126.3: The great things that the LORD has done for us gladden us.
126.4: Restore our exiles, LORD, like the streams of the Negev.
126.5: Those who weep while they plant will sing for joy while they harvest.
126.6: The one who goes out weeping, carrying a bag of seeds, will surely return with a joyful song, bearing sheaves from his harvest.

127.1: Unless the LORD builds the house, its builders labor uselessly. Unless the LORD guards the city, its security forces keep watch uselessly.
127.2: It is useless to get up early and to stay up late, eating the food of exhausting labor— truly he gives sleep to those he loves.
127.3: Children are a gift from the LORD; a productive womb, the LORD's reward.
127.4: As arrows in the hand of a warrior, so also are children born during one's youth.
127.5: How blessed is the man whose quiver is full of them! He will not be ashamed as they confront their enemies at the city gate.

128.1: How blessed are all who fear the LORD as they follow in his ways.
128.2: You will eat from the work of your hands; you will be happy, and it will go well for you.
128.3: Your wife will be like a fruitful vine within your house; your children like olive shoots surrounding your table.
128.4: See how the man will be blessed who fears the LORD.
128.5: May the LORD bless you from Zion, and may you observe the prosperity of Jerusalem every day that you live!
128.6: And may you see your children's children! Peace be on Israel!

129.1: "Since my youth they have often persecuted me," let Israel repeat it,
129.2: "Since my youth they have often persecuted me, yet they haven't defeated me.
129.3: Wicked people ploughed over my back, creating long-lasting wounds."
129.4: The LORD is righteous— he has cut me free from the cords of the wicked.
129.5: Let all who hate Zion be turned away and be ashamed.
129.6: May they become like a tuft of grass on a roof top, that withers before it takes root—
129.7: not enough to fill one's hand or to bundle in one's arms.
129.8: And may those who pass by never tell them, "May the LORD's blessing be upon you. We bless you in the name of the LORD."

130.1: I cry to you from the depths, LORD,
130.2: Lord, listen to my voice; let your ears pay attention to what I ask of you!
130.3: LORD, if you were to record iniquities, Lord, who could remain standing?
130.4: But with you there is forgiveness, so that you may be feared.
130.5: I wait for the LORD; my soul waits, and I will hope in his word.
130.6: My soul looks to the Lord more than watchmen look for the morning— more, indeed, than watchmen for the morning.
130.7: Israel, hope in the LORD! For with the LORD there is gracious love, along with abundant redemption.
130.8: And he will redeem Israel from all its sins.

131.1: LORD, my heart is not arrogant, nor do I look haughty. I do not aspire to great things, nor concern myself with things beyond my ability.
131.2: Instead, I have composed and quieted myself like a weaned child with its mother; I am like a weaned child.
131.3: Place your hope in the LORD, Israel, both now and forever.

132.1: LORD, remember in David's favor all of his troubles;
132.2: how he swore an oath to the LORD, vowing to the Mighty One of Jacob,
132.3: "I will not enter my house, or lie down on my bed,
132.4: or let myself go to sleep or even take a nap,
132.5: until I locate a place for the LORD, a dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob."
132.6: We heard about it in Ephrata; we found it in the fields of Jaar.
132.7: Let's go to his dwelling place and worship at his footstool.
132.8: Arise, LORD, and go to your resting place, you and the ark of your strength.
132.9: May your priests be clothed with righteousness and may your godly ones shout for joy.
132.10: For the sake of your servant David, don't turn away the face of your anointed one.
132.11: The LORD made an oath to David from which he will not retreat: "One of your sons I will set in place on your throne.
132.12: If your sons keep my covenant and my statutes that I will teach them, then their sons will also sit on your throne forever."
132.13: For the LORD has chosen Zion, desiring it as his dwelling place.
132.14: "This is my resting place forever. Here I will live, because I desire to do so.
132.15: I will bless its provisions abundantly; I will satiate its poor with food.
132.16: I will clothe its priests with salvation and its godly ones will shout for joy.
132.17: There I will create a power base for David— I have prepared a lamp for my anointed one.
132.18: I will clothe his enemies with disgrace, but on him his crown will shine."

133.1: Look how good and how pleasant it is when brothers live together in unity!
133.2: It is like precious oil on the head, descending to the beard— even to Aaron's beard— and flowing down to the edge of his robes.
133.3: It is like the dew of Hermon falling on Zion's mountains. For there the LORD commanded his blessing— life everlasting.

134.1: Now bless the LORD, all you servants of the LORD who serve nightly in the LORD's Temple.
134.2: Lift up your hands to the Holy Place and bless the LORD.
134.3: May the LORD who fashions heaven and earth bless you from Zion.

135.1: Hallelujah! Praise the name of the LORD! Give praise, you servants of the LORD,
135.2: you who are standing in the LORD's Temple, in the courtyards of the house of our God.
135.3: Praise the LORD, because the LORD is good; Sing to his name, for he is gracious.
135.4: It is Jacob whom the LORD chose for himself— Israel as his personal possession.
135.5: Indeed, I know that the LORD is great, and that our Lord surpasses all gods.
135.6: The LORD does whatever pleases him in heaven and on earth, in the seas and all its deep regions.
135.7: He makes the clouds rise from the ends of the earth, fashioning lightning for the rain, bringing the wind from his storehouses.
135.8: It was the LORD who struck down the firstborn of Egypt, including both men and animals.
135.9: He sent signs and wonders among you, Egypt, before Pharaoh and all his servants.
135.10: He struck down many nations, killing many kings—
135.11: Sihon, king of the Amorites, Og, king of Bashan, and every kingdom of Canaan—
135.12: and he gave their land as an inheritance, an inheritance to his people Israel.
135.13: Your name, LORD, exists forever, and your reputation, LORD, throughout the ages.
135.14: For the LORD will vindicate his people, and he will show compassion on his servants.
135.15: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, worked by the hands of human beings.
135.16: Mouths are attributed to them, but they cannot speak; sight is attributed to them, but they cannot see;
135.17: ears are attributed to them, but they do not hear, and there is no breath in their mouths.
135.18: Those who craft them— and all who trust in them— will become like them.
135.19: House of Israel, bless the LORD! House of Aaron, bless the LORD!
135.20: House of Levi, bless the LORD! You who fear the LORD, bless the LORD!
135.21: Blessed be the LORD from Zion, he who lives in Jerusalem. Hallelujah!

136.1: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, for his gracious love is everlasting.
136.2: Give thanks to the God of gods, for his gracious love is everlasting.
136.3: Give thanks to the Lord of lords, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.4: To the one who alone does great and wondrous things, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.5: to the one who by wisdom made the heavens, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.6: to the one who spread out the earth over the waters, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.7: to the one who made the great lights, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.8: the sun to illumine the day, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.9: and the moon and stars to illumine the night, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.10: to the one who struck the firstborn of Egypt, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.11: and brought Israel out from among them, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.12: with a strong hand and an active arm, for his gracious love is everlasting.
136.13: To the one who split the Reed Sea in two for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.14: and made Israel pass through the middle of it, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.15: and cast Pharaoh and his armies into the Reed Sea, for his gracious love is everlasting.
136.16: To the one who led his people into the wilderness, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.17: to the one who struck down great kings, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.18: and killed famous kings, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.19: including Sihon king of the Amorites, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.20: and Og king of Bashan, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.21: and gave their land as an inheritance, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.22: to Israel his servant as a possession, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.23: He it is who remembered us in our lowly circumstances, for his gracious love is everlasting—
136.24: and rescued us from our enemies, for his gracious love is everlasting.
136.25: He gives food to all creatures, for his gracious love is everlasting.
136.26: Give thanks to the God of Heaven, for his gracious love is everlasting.

137.1: There we sat down and cried— by the rivers of Babylon— as we remembered Zion.
137.2: On the willows there we hung our harps,
137.3: for it was there that our captors asked us for songs and our torturers demanded joy from us, "Sing us one of the songs about Zion!"
137.4: How are we to sing the song of the LORD on foreign soil?
137.5: If I forget you, Jerusalem, may my right hand cease to function.
137.6: May my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I don't remember you, if I don't consider Jerusalem to be more important than my highest joy.
137.7: Remember the day of Jerusalem's fall, LORD, because of the Edomites, who kept saying, "Tear it down! Tear it right down to its foundations!"
137.8: Daughter of Babylon! You devastator! How blessed will be the one who pays you back for what you have done to us.
137.9: How blessed will be the one who seizes your young children and pulverizes them against the cliff!

138.1: LORD, I thank you with all of my heart; because you heard the words that I spoke, I will sing your praise before the heavenly beings.
138.2: I will bow down in worship toward your holy Temple and give thanks to your name for your gracious love and truth, for you have done great things to carry out your word consistent with your name.
138.3: When I called out, you answered me; you strengthened me.
138.4: LORD, all the kings of the earth will give you thanks, for they have heard what you have spoken.
138.5: They will sing about the ways of the LORD, for great is the glory of the LORD!
138.6: Though the LORD is highly exalted, yet he pays attention to those who are lowly regarded, but he is aware of the arrogant from afar.
138.7: Though I walk straight into trouble, you preserve my life, stretching out your hand to fight the vehemence of my enemies, and your right hand delivers me.
138.8: The LORD will complete what his purpose is for me. LORD, your gracious love is eternal; do not abandon your personal work in me.

139.1: LORD, you have examined me; you have known me.
139.2: You know when I rest and when I am active. You understand what I am thinking when I am distant from you.
139.3: You scrutinize my life and my rest; you are familiar with all of my ways.
139.4: Even before I have formed a word with my tongue, you, LORD, know it completely!
139.5: You encircle me from back to front, placing your hand upon me.
139.6: Knowledge like this is too amazing for me. It is beyond my reach, and I cannot fathom it.
139.7: Where can I flee from your spirit? Or where will I run from your presence?
139.8: If I rise to heaven, there you are! If I lay down with the dead, there you are!
139.9: If I take wings with the dawn and settle down on the western horizon
139.10: your hand will guide me there, too, while your right hand keeps a firm grip on me.
139.11: If I say, "Darkness will surely conceal me, and the light around me will become night,"
139.12: even darkness isn't dark to you, darkness and light are the same to you.
139.13: It was you who formed my internal organs, fashioning me within my mother's womb.
139.14: I praise you, because you are fearful and wondrous! Your work is wonderful, and I am fully aware of it.
139.15: My frame was not hidden from you while I was being crafted in a hidden place, knit together in the depths of the earth.
139.16: Your eyes looked upon my embryo, and everything was recorded in your book. The days scheduled for my formation were inscribed, even though not one of them had come yet.
139.17: How deep are your thoughts, God! How great is their number!
139.18: Were I to count them, they would number more than the sand. When I awake, I will be with you.
139.19: God, if only you would execute the wicked, so that the men guilty of bloodshed would get away from me,
139.20: who speak against you with evil motives, your enemies who are acting in vain.
139.21: I hate those who hate you, LORD, do I not? I loathe those who rebel against you, do I not ?
139.22: With consummate hatred I hate them; I consider them my enemies.
139.23: Examine me, God, and know my mind, test me, and know my thoughts.
139.24: See if there is any offensive tendency in me, and lead me in the eternal way.

140.1: Deliver me, LORD, from evil people, preserve me from violent men,
140.2: who craft evil plans in their minds, inciting wars every day.
140.3: They sharpen their tongues like a serpent; the venom of vipers is on their lips. Interlude
140.4: Protect me, LORD, from the control of evil people, from violent men who have planned to trip me.
140.5: The arrogant have laid a trap for me; they have spread a net with ropes, lining it with snares along the way. Interlude
140.6: So I say to the LORD, "You are my God; listen to my voice as I plead for mercy, LORD.
140.7: LORD, my Lord, my strong deliverer, you have protected my head in the time of battle.
140.8: Never grant, LORD, the desires of the wicked; never condone their plans so they cannot exalt themselves. Interlude
140.9: May those who surround me discover that the trouble they talk about falls on their own head!
140.10: May burning coals fall on them; may they be cast into fire, and into miry pits, never to rise again.
140.11: Let not the slanderer become established in the land. May evil quickly hunt down the violent man.
140.12: I know that the LORD will act on behalf of the tormented, providing justice for the needy.
140.13: Surely the righteous will give thanks to your name, while the upright live in your presence.

141.1: LORD, I call to you, be quick to listen to me when I cry out!
141.2: Let my prayer be like incense offered before you, and my uplifted hands like the evening sacrifice.
141.3: LORD, set a guard over my mouth; keep watch over the door to my lips.
141.4: Don't let my heart turn toward evil or involve itself in wicked activities with men who practice iniquity. Let me not feast on their delicacies.
141.5: Let one who is righteous strike me; It is an act of gracious love. Let him rebuke me, because it is oil for my head; do not let my head refuse it. My prayers continuously will be against their wicked activities.
141.6: When their judges are thrown off the cliff, the people will hear my words, for they are appropriate.
141.7: Just as one plows and breaks up the earth, our bones are scattered near the entrance to the place of the dead.
141.8: Nevertheless, my eyes are on you, Lord GOD, as I seek protection in you. Don't leave me defenseless!
141.9: Protect me from the trap laid for me and from the snares of those who practice evil.
141.10: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I come through.

142.1: My voice cries out to the LORD; my voice pleads for mercy to the LORD.
142.2: I pour out my complaint to him, telling him all of my troubles.
142.3: Though my spirit grows faint within me, you are aware of my path. Wherever I go, they have hidden a trap for me.
142.4: I look to my right and observe— no one is concerned about me. There is nowhere I can go for refuge, and no one cares for me.
142.5: So I cry to you, Lord, declaring, "You are my refuge, my only possession while I am on this earth."
142.6: Pay attention to my cry, for I have been brought very low. Deliver me from my tormentors, for they are far too strong for me.
142.7: Break me out of this prison, so I can give thanks to your name. The righteous will surround me, for you will deal generously with me.

143.1: LORD, hear my prayer; pay attention to my request, because you are faithful; answer me in your righteousness.
143.2: Do not enter into judgment with your servant, for no living person is righteous in your sight.
143.3: For those who oppose me are pursuing my life, crushing me to the ground, making me sit in darkness like those who died long ago.
143.4: As a result, my spirit is desolate within me, and my mind within me is appalled.
143.5: I remember the former times, meditating on everything you have done. I think about the work of your hands.
143.6: I stretch out my hands toward you, longing for you like a parched land. Interlude
143.7: Answer me quickly, LORD; my spirit is failing. Do not hide your face from me; otherwise, I will become like those who descend to the Pit,
143.8: In the morning let me hear of your gracious love, for in you I trust. Cause me to know the way I should take, because I have set my hope on you.
143.9: Deliver me from my enemies, LORD. I have taken refuge in you.
143.10: Teach me to do your will, for you are my God. Let your good Spirit lead me on level ground.
143.11: For the sake of your name, LORD, preserve my life. Because you are righteous, bring me out of trouble.
143.12: Because of your gracious love, you will cut off my enemies. You will destroy all who oppose me, for I am your servant.

144.1: Blessed be the LORD, my rock, who trains my hands for battle and my fingers for warfare,
144.2: he is my gracious love and my fortress, my strong tower and my deliverer, my shield and the one in whom I find refuge, who subdues peoples under me.
144.3: LORD, what are human beings, that you should care about them, or mortal man, that you should think about him?
144.4: The human person is a mere empty breath; his days are like a fading shadow.
144.5: Bow your heavens, LORD, and descend; touch the mountains, and they will smolder.
144.6: Send forth lightning and scatter the enemy, shoot your arrows and confuse them.
144.7: Reach down your hand from your high place; rescue me and deliver me from mighty waters, from the control of foreigners.
144.8: Their mouths speak lies, and their right hand deceives,
144.9: God, I will sing a new song to you. On a harp of ten strings I will play to you—
144.10: to you who gives victory to kings, rescuing his servant David from cruel swords.
144.11: Rescue me and deliver me from the control of foreigners, whose mouths speak lies, and whose right hand deceives.
144.12: May our sons in their youth be like full-grown plants, and our daughters like pillars destined to decorate a palace.
144.13: May our granaries be filled, storing produce in abundance; may our sheep bring forth thousands, even tens of thousands in our fields.
144.14: May our cattle grow heavy with young, with no damage or loss. May there be no cry of anguish in our streets!
144.15: Happy are the people to whom these things come; happy are the people whose God is the LORD.

145.1: I will speak highly of you, my God and King, and I will bless your name forever and ever.
145.2: I will bless you every day and I will praise your name forever and ever.
145.3: The LORD is great, and to be praised highly, though his greatness is indescribable.
145.4: One generation will acclaim your works to another and will describe your mighty actions.
145.5: I will speak about the glorious splendor of your majesty as well as your awesome actions.
145.6: People will speak about the might of your great deeds, and I will announce your greatness.
145.7: They will extol the fame of your abundant goodness, and will sing out loud about your righteousness.
145.8: Gracious and merciful is the LORD, slow to become angry, and overflowing with gracious love.
145.9: The LORD is good to everyone and his mercies extend to everything he does.
145.10: LORD, everything you have done will praise you, and your holy ones will bless you.
145.11: They will speak about the glory of your kingdom, and they will talk about your might,
145.12: in order to make known your mighty acts to mankind as well as the majestic splendor of your kingdom.
145.13: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and your authority endures from one generation to another. [13b] God is faithful about everything he says and merciful in everything he does.
145.14: The LORD supports everyone who falls and raises up those who are bowed down.
145.15: Everyone's eyes are on you, as you give them their food in due time.
145.16: You open your hand and keep on satisfying the desire of every living thing.
145.17: The LORD is righteous in all of his ways and graciously loving in all of his activities.
145.18: The LORD remains near to all who call out to him, to everyone who calls out to him sincerely.
145.19: He fulfills the desire of those who fear him, hearing their cry and saving them.
145.20: The LORD preserves everyone who loves him, but he will destroy all of the wicked.
145.21: My mouth will praise the LORD, and all creatures will bless his holy name forever and ever.

146.1: Hallelujah! Praise the LORD, my soul!
146.2: I will praise the LORD as long as I live, singing praises to my God while I exist.
146.3: Do not look to nobles, nor to mere human beings who cannot save.
146.4: When they stop breathing, they return to the ground; on that very day their plans evaporate!
146.5: Happy is the one whose help is the God of Jacob, whose hope is in the LORD his God,
146.6: maker of heaven and earth, the seas and everything in them, forever the guardian of truth,
146.7: who brings justice for the oppressed, and who gives food to the hungry. The LORD frees the prisoners;
146.8: the LORD gives sight to the blind. The LORD lifts up those who are weighed down. The LORD loves the righteous.
146.9: The LORD stands guard over the stranger; he supports both widows and orphans, but makes the path of the wicked slippery.
146.10: The LORD will reign forever, your God, Zion, for all generations! Hallelujah!

147.1: Hallelujah! It is good to sing praise to our God, and it is fitting to sing glorious praise.
147.2: The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem; he gathers together the outcasts of Israel.
147.3: He heals the brokenhearted, binding up their injuries.
147.4: He keeps track of the number of stars, assigning names to all of them.
147.5: Our Lord is great, and rich in power; his understanding has no limitation.
147.6: The LORD supports the afflicted while he casts the wicked to the ground.
147.7: Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving, and compose music to our God with the lyre.
147.8: He shields the heavens with clouds, preparing rain for the earth and making grass grow on the hills.
147.9: He gives wild animals their food, including the young ravens when they cry.
147.10: He takes no delight in the strength of a horse, and gains no pleasure in the runner's swiftness.
147.11: But the LORD is pleased with those who fear him, with those who depend on his gracious love.
147.12: Glorify the LORD, Jerusalem! Praise your God, Zion!
147.13: For he has strengthened the bars of your gates, blessing your children within you.
147.14: He grants peace within your borders, satisfying you with the finest of wheat.
147.15: He sends out his command to the earth, making his word go forth quickly.
147.16: He supplies snow like wool, scattering frost like ashes.
147.17: He casts down his ice crystals like bread fragments. Who can endure his freezing cold?
147.18: He sends out his word and melts them. He makes his wind blow and the water flows.
147.19: He declares his words to Jacob, his statutes and decrees to Israel.
147.20: He has not dealt with any other nation like this; they never knew his decrees. Hallelujah!

148.1: Hallelujah! Praise the LORD from heaven; praise him in the highest places.
148.2: Praise him, all his angels; praise him, all his armies!
148.3: Praise him, sun and moon; praise him, all you shining stars.
148.4: Praise him, you heaven of heavens, and you waters above the heavens.
148.5: Let them praise the name of the LORD, for he himself gave the command that they be created.
148.6: He set them in place to last forever and ever; he gave the command and will not rescind it.
148.7: Praise the LORD, you from the earth, you creatures of the sea and all you depths,
148.8: fire, hail, snow, fog, and wind storm that carry out his command,
148.9: mountains and every hill, fruit trees and cedars,
148.10: living creatures and livestock, insects and flying birds,
148.11: earthly kings and all peoples, nobles and all court officials of the earth,
148.12: young men and young women alike, along with older people and children.
148.13: Let them praise the name of the LORD, for his name alone is lifted up; his majesty transcends earth and heaven.
148.14: He has raised up a source of strength for his people, an object of praise for all of his holy ones, that is, for the people of Israel who are near him. Hallelujah!

149.1: Hallelujah! Sing a new song to the LORD, praising him where the godly gather together.
149.2: May Israel rejoice in its Maker, and Zion's descendants in their King!
149.3: May they praise his name with dancing, chanting songs to him with tambourines and lyres.
149.4: For the LORD is pleased with his people; he beautifies the afflicted with salvation.
149.5: May those he loves be exalted, singing for joy on their couches.
149.6: Let high praises to God be heard in their throats, while they wield two-edged swords in their hands
149.7: as they bring retribution to nations and punishment to peoples,
149.8: binding their kings with chains, their officials with iron bands,
149.9: and executing the judgment written against them. This is honor for all the ones he loves. Hallelujah!

150.1: Hallelujah! Praise God in his Holy Place. Praise him in his great expanse.
150.2: Praise him for his mighty works. Praise him according to his excellent greatness.
150.3: Praise him with trumpet sounding. Praise him with stringed instrument and harp.
150.4: Praise him with tambourine and dancing. Praise him with stringed and wind instruments.
150.5: Praise him with loud cymbals. Praise him with reverberating cymbals.
150.6: Let everyone who breathes praise the LORD. Hallelujah!

1.1: The proverbs of David's son Solomon, king of Israel.
1.2: These proverbs are for gaining wisdom and discipline; for understanding words of insight;
1.3: for acquiring the discipline that produces wise behavior, righteousness, justice, and upright living;
1.4: for giving prudence to the naïve, and knowledge and discretion to the young.
1.5: Let the wise listen and increase their learning; let the person of understanding receive guidance
1.6: in understanding proverbs, clever sayings, words of the wise, and their riddles.
1.7: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and discipline.
1.8: My son, listen to your father's instruction, and do not let go of your mother's teaching.
1.9: They will be a graceful wreath for your head and a chain for your neck.
1.10: My son, if sinners entice you, do not consent.
1.11: If they say, "Come with us! Let's lie in wait for blood; let's ambush some innocent person for no reason at all.
1.12: Let's swallow them alive like Sheol, and whole like those who go down into the Pit.
1.13: We'll find all kinds of valuable wealth, and we'll fill our houses with spoil.
1.14: Throw your lot in with us, and all of us will have one purse."
1.15: My son, do not go along with them, and keep your feet away from their paths!
1.16: For they run toward evil; these enticers shed blood without hesitation.
1.17: Look, it is useless to spread a net in full view of all the birds,
1.18: but these people lie in wait for their own blood. They ambush only themselves.
1.19: Such is the way of all those who seek illicit gain— it takes away the lives of those who possess it.
1.20: Wisdom cries out in the street; she raises her voice in the public squares.
1.21: She calls out at the busiest part of the noisy streets, and at the entrance to the gates of the city she utters her words:
1.22: "You naïve ones, how long will you love naivete? And how long will scoffers delight in scoffing or fools hate knowledge?"
1.23: Return to my correction! Look, I will pour out my spirit on you, and I will make my words known to you.
1.24: "Because I called out to you and you refused to respond— I appealed, but no one paid attention—
1.25: because you neglected all my advice and did not want my correction,
1.26: I will laugh at your calamity. I will mock when what you fear comes,
1.27: when what you dread comes like a storm, and your calamity comes on like a whirlwind, when distress and anguish come upon you.
1.28: "Then they will call out to me, but I will not answer; they will seek me diligently, but they will not find me.
1.29: "Because they hated knowledge and did not choose the fear of the LORD;
1.30: they did not want my advice, and they rejected all my correction.
1.31: They will eat the fruit of their way, and they will be filled with their own devices.
1.32: Indeed, the waywardness of the naïve will kill them, and the complacency of fools will destroy them.
1.33: "But the person who listens to me will live safely and will be secure from the fear of evil."

2.1: My son, if you accept my words, and treasure my instructions —
2.2: making your ear attentive to wisdom, and turning your heart to understanding—
2.3: if, indeed, you call out for insight and raise your voice for understanding,
2.4: if you seek it like silver and search for it like hidden treasure,
2.5: then you will understand the fear of the LORD and learn to know God.
2.6: For the LORD gives wisdom, and from his mouth come knowledge and understanding.
2.7: He stores up sound wisdom for the upright and is a shield to those who walk in integrity—
2.8: guarding the paths of the just and protecting the way of his faithful ones.
2.9: Then you will understand what is right, just, and upright—every good path.
2.10: For wisdom will enter your heart, and knowledge will be pleasant to your soul.
2.11: Discretion will protect you; understanding will watch over you,
2.12: delivering you from the way of evil, from men who speak perverse things,
2.13: and from those who abandon the right path to travel along the ways of darkness;
2.14: who delight in doing evil, and rejoice in the perverseness of evil;
2.15: whose paths are crooked and who are devious in their ways,
2.16: delivering you from the adulteress, from the immoral woman with her seductive words,
2.17: someone who abandoned the companion of her youth and forgot the covenant of her God.
2.18: For her house leads down to death, and her paths down to the realm of the dead.
2.19: None who go to her return, nor do they reach the paths of life.
2.20: This is how you will walk in the way of good men and will keep to the paths of the righteous.
2.21: For the upright will live in the land, and people of integrity will remain in it.
2.22: But the wicked will be cut off from the land, and the treacherous will be uprooted from it.

3.1: My son, don't forget my instruction, and keep my commandments carefully in mind.
3.2: For they will add length to your days, years to your life, and abundant peace to you.
3.3: Do not let gracious love and truth leave you. Bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart,
3.4: and find favor and a good reputation with God and men.
3.5: Trust in the LORD with all your heart, and do not depend on your own understanding.
3.6: In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.
3.7: Do not be wise in your own opinion. Fear the LORD and turn away from evil.
3.8: This will bring healing to your body, and refreshment to your bones.
3.9: Honor the LORD with your wealth and with the first of all your produce,
3.10: so your barns will be filled with abundance, and your vats will burst open with new wine.
3.11: My son, do not reject the LORD's discipline, and do not despise his correction,
3.12: because the LORD corrects the person he loves, just as a father corrects the son he delights in.
3.13: How joyful is the man who finds wisdom, and the man who gains understanding,
3.14: because her profit is better than the profit of silver, and her yield than fine gold.
3.15: She is more precious than rubies, and nothing you desire compares with her.
3.16: Long life is in her right hand, and in her left are riches and honor.
3.17: Her ways are pleasant ways, and all her paths are peaceful.
3.18: She is a tree of life for those who embrace her, and whoever clutches her tightly will be joyful.
3.19: By wisdom the LORD laid the earth's foundations, and by understanding he set the heavens in place.
3.20: By his knowledge the depths broke open, and the clouds drip with dew.
3.21: My son, do not let wisdom leave your sight. Carefully observe sound judgment and discernment,
3.22: and they will be life to you and a graceful ornament for your neck.
3.23: Then you will travel safely on your way, and your foot will not stumble.
3.24: When you sit down, you will not be afraid; when you lie down, your sleep will be pleasant.
3.25: Do not be afraid of sudden disaster, or the devastation that comes to the wicked.
3.26: Indeed, the LORD will be your confidence, and he will keep your foot from being caught.
3.27: Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in your power to act.
3.28: Do not say to your neighbor, "Go, and come back. I will pay you tomorrow," when you have cash with you.
3.29: Do not plan to harm your neighbor, when he is living peacefully beside you.
3.30: Do not bring a lawsuit against a person for no reason, when he has done you no harm.
3.31: Do not envy a violent man, and do not emulate his lifestyle.
3.32: Indeed, a perverse man is utterly disgusting to the LORD, but he takes the upright into his confidence.
3.33: The LORD's curse is on the house of the wicked, but he blesses the dwelling of the righteous.
3.34: Though God scoffs at scoffers, he gives grace to the humble.
3.35: The wise will inherit honor, but he holds fools up for ridicule.

4.1: Listen, children, to your father's instruction, and pay attention in order to gain understanding.
4.2: I give you sound teaching, so do not abandon my instruction.
4.3: When I was a son to my father, not yet strong and an only son to my mother,
4.4: he taught me and told me, "Let your heart fully embrace what I have to say; keep my commandments and live!
4.5: Get wisdom! Get understanding! Do not forget or turn aside from the words of my mouth!
4.6: Do not abandon her, and she will protect you. Love her, and she will watch over you.
4.7: Wisdom is of utmost importance, therefore get wisdom, and with all your effort work to acquire understanding.
4.8: Prize her and she will exalt you. Indeed, if you embrace her, she will honor you.
4.9: She will place on your head a graceful garland; she will present to you a crown of beauty."
4.10: Listen, my son: accept my words, and you'll live a long, long time.
4.11: I have directed you in the way of wisdom, and I have led you along straight paths.
4.12: When you walk, your step will not be hindered, and when you run, you will not stumble.
4.13: Hold on to instruction, do not let it go! Guard wisdom, because she is your life!
4.14: Do not enter the path of the wicked, or go along the way of evil men.
4.15: Avoid it! Don't travel on it! Turn away from it, and pass on by.
4.16: For they cannot sleep unless they are doing evil, and they are robbed of their sleep unless they cause someone to stumble.
4.17: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and they drink the wine of violence.
4.18: The path of the righteous is like the light of dawn that grows brighter until the full light of day.
4.19: But the way of the wicked is like deep darkness, and they do not know what they are stumbling over.
4.20: My son, pay attention to my words, and listen closely to what I say.
4.21: Do not let them out of your sight; keep them within your heart.
4.22: For they are life to those who find them, and healing to their whole body.
4.23: Above everything else guard your heart, because from it flow the springs of life.
4.24: Never talk deceptively and don't keep company with people whose speech is corrupt.
4.25: Let your eyes look directly ahead; fix your gaze straight in front of you.
4.26: Carefully measure the paths for your feet, and all your ways will be established.
4.27: Do not turn to the right or to the left; turn your foot away from evil.

5.1: My son, pay attention to my wisdom, and listen closely to my insight,
5.2: so you may carefully practice discretion and your lips preserve knowledge.
5.3: For the lips of an adulteress drip honey, and her speech is smoother than oil.
5.4: But in the end she is as bitter as wormwood, and as sharp as a double-edged sword.
5.5: Her feet go down to death; her steps lead to Sheol.
5.6: You aren't thinking about where her life is headed; her steps wander, but you do not realize it.
5.7: Now, children, listen to me. Don't turn away from what I am saying.
5.8: Keep far away from her, and don't go near the entrance to her house,
5.9: so that you don't give your honor to others, and waste your best years;
5.10: so that strangers don't enrich themselves at your expense, and your work won't end up the possession of foreigners.
5.11: You will cry out in anguish when your end comes, when your flesh and body are consumed,
5.12: and you will say, "How I hated instruction, and my heart rejected correction!
5.13: I did not obey my teachers and did not listen to my instructors.
5.14: Now I am at the point of utter disaster in the assembly and in the congregation."
5.15: Drink water from your own cistern, and fresh water from your own well.
5.16: Should your springs flow outside, or streams of water in the street?
5.17: They should be for you alone and not for strangers who are with you.
5.18: Let your fountain be blessed and enjoy the wife of your youth.
5.19: Like a loving deer, a beautiful doe, let her breasts satisfy you all the time. Be constantly intoxicated by her love.
5.20: Why should you be intoxicated by an adulteress, my son, and embrace the bosom of a foreign woman?
5.21: Indeed, what a man does is always in the LORD's presence, and he weighs all his paths.
5.22: The wicked person's iniquities will capture him, and he will be held with the cords of his sin.
5.23: He will die for lack of discipline, and he goes astray because of his great folly.

6.1: My son, if you guarantee a loan for your neighbor, if you have agreed to a deal with a stranger,
6.2: trapped by your own words, and caught by your own words,
6.3: then do this, my son, and deliver yourself, because you have come under your neighbor's control. Go, humble yourself! Plead passionately with your neighbor!
6.4: Don't allow yourself to sleep or even to close your eyes.
6.5: Deliver yourself like a gazelle from a hunter's hand, or like a bird from a fowler's hand.
6.6: Go to the ant, you lazy man! Observe its ways and become wise.
6.7: It has no commander, officer, or ruler,
6.8: but prepares its provisions in the summer and gathers its food in the harvest.
6.9: How long will you lie down, lazy man? When will you get up from your sleep?
6.10: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest,
6.11: and your poverty will come on you like a bandit and your desperation like an armed man.
6.12: A worthless man, a wicked man, goes around with devious speech,
6.13: winking with his eyes, making signs with his feet, pointing with his fingers,
6.14: planning evil with a perverse mind, continually stirring up discord.
6.15: Therefore, disaster will overtake him suddenly. He will be broken in an instant, and he will never recover.
6.16: Here are six things that the LORD hates— seven, in fact, are detestable to him:
6.17: Arrogant eyes, a lying tongue, and hands shedding innocent blood;
6.18: a heart crafting evil plans, feet running swiftly to wickedness,
6.19: a false witness snorting lies, and someone sowing quarrels between brothers.
6.20: Keep your father's commands, my son, and never forsake your mother's rules,
6.21: by binding them to your heart continuously, fastening them around your neck.
6.22: During your travels wisdom will lead you; she will watch over you while you rest; and when you are startled from your sleep, she will commune with you.
6.23: Because the command is a lamp and the Law a light, rebukes that discipline are a way of life—
6.24: to protect you from the evil woman, from the words of the seductive woman.
6.25: Do not focus on her beauty in your mind, nor allow her to take you prisoner with her flirting eyes,
6.26: because the price of a whore is a loaf of bread, and an adulterous woman stalks a man's precious life.
6.27: Can a man scoop fire into his bosom without burning his clothes?
6.28: Can a man walk on hot coals without scorching his feet?
6.29: So also is it with someone who has sex with his neighbor's wife; anyone touching her will not remain unpunished.
6.30: A thief isn't despised if he steals to meet his needs when he is hungry,
6.31: but when he is discovered, he must restore seven-fold, forfeiting the entire value of his house.
6.32: Whoever commits adultery with a woman is out of his mind; by doing so he corrupts his own soul.
6.33: He will receive a beating and dishonor, and his shame won't disappear,
6.34: because jealousy incites a strong man's rage, and he will show no mercy when it's time for revenge.
6.35: He will not consider any payment, nor will he be willing to accept it, no matter how large the bribe.

7.1: My son, guard what I say and treasure my commands.
7.2: Keep my commands and you'll live. Guard my teaching as you do your eyesight.
7.3: Strap them to your fingers and engrave them on the tablet of your heart.
7.4: Say to wisdom, "You're my sister!" and call understanding your close relative,
7.5: so they can keep you from an adulterous woman, from the immoral woman with her seductive words.
7.6: For from a window in my house I peered through the lattice work,
7.7: and I noticed among the naïve— that is, I discerned among the youths— a senseless young man.
7.8: Proceeding down the street near her corner, he makes his way toward her house
7.9: at twilight, during the evening, even during the darkest part of the night.
7.10: Look! A woman makes her way to meet him, dressed as a prostitute and intending to entrap him.
7.11: She is brazen and defiant— her feet don't remain at home.
7.12: Now she is in the street, now in the plazas, she lurks near every corner.
7.13: So she grabs hold of him and kisses him, with a brazen face she speaks to him,
7.14: "I have given my peace offerings, and today I fulfilled my vows.
7.15: Therefore, I've come out to meet you, I've looked just for you, and I found you!
7.16: I've decorated my bed with new coverings— embroidered linen from Egypt.
7.17: I've perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
7.18: Come, let's make love until dawn; let's comfort ourselves with love,
7.19: because my husband isn't home. He left on a long trip.
7.20: He took a fist full of cash and he'll return home in a month."
7.21: She leads him astray with great persuasion; with flattering lips she seduces him.
7.22: All of a sudden he follows her like an ox fit for slaughter or like a fool fit for a trap
7.23: until an arrow pierces his liver. As a bird darts into a snare, he doesn't realize his fatal decision.
7.24: So listen to me, my sons, and pay attention to what I have to say.
7.25: Don't be led astray by her lifestyle, and don't imitate her behavior.
7.26: For many are the victims whom she has conquered, and many are her slain.
7.27: Her house leads to Sheol, descending to death's catacombs.

8.1: Isn't wisdom calling out; isn't understanding raising her voice?
8.2: On top of the highest places along the road she stands where the roads meet.
8.3: Beside the gates, at the city entrance— at the entrance to the portals she cries aloud:
8.4: "I'm calling to you, men! What I have to say pertains to all mankind!
8.5: Understand prudence, you naïve people; and gain an understanding heart, you foolish ones.
8.6: Listen, because I have noble things to say, and what I have to say will reveal what is right.
8.7: For my mouth speaks the truth— wickedness is detestable to me.
8.8: Everything I have to say is just; there isn't anything corrupt or perverse in my speech.
8.9: Everything I say is sensible to someone who understands, and correct to those who have acquired knowledge.
8.10: Grab hold of my instruction in lieu of money and knowledge instead of the finest gold,
8.11: because wisdom is better than precious gems and nothing you desire can compare to it."
8.12: "I, wisdom, am related to prudence. I know how to be discreet.
8.13: The fear of the LORD is to hate evil. Pride, arrogance, an evil lifestyle, and perverted speech I despise.
8.14: Counsel belongs to me, along with sound judgment. I am understanding. Power belongs to me.
8.15: Kings reign by me, and rulers dispense justice through me.
8.16: By me leaders rule, as do noble officials and all who govern justly.
8.17: I love those who love me, and those who seek me will find me.
8.18: Wealth and honor accompany me, as do enduring wealth and righteousness.
8.19: My fruit is better than gold, better than even refined gold, and my benefit surpasses the purest silver.
8.20: I walk on the way of righteousness, along paths that are just,
8.21: I bequeath wealth to those who love me, and I will fill their treasuries."
8.22: "The LORD made me as he began his planning, before his ancient activity commenced.
8.23: From eternity I was appointed, from the beginning, from before there was land.
8.24: When there were no ocean depths, I brought them to birth at a time when there were no springs.
8.25: Before the mountains were shaped, before there were hills, I was bringing them to birth.
8.26: Even though he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the world's first grains of dust,
8.27: when he crafted the heavens, I was there— when he marked out a circle on the face of the deep,
8.28: when he made the clouds from above, when the springs of the depths were established,
8.29: when he set a boundary for the sea so the waters would not exceed his limits, when he marked out the foundations of the earth.
8.30: Then I was with him, his master craftsman— I was his delight daily, continuously rejoicing in his presence,
8.31: rejoicing in his inhabitable world and taking delight in mankind."
8.32: "So listen to me, children! Blessed are those who obey me.
8.33: Listen to instruction and be wise. Don't ignore it.
8.34: Blessed is the person who listens to me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at my doorways—
8.35: because those who find me find life and gain favor from the LORD.
8.36: But whoever sins against me destroys himself; everyone who hates me loves death."

9.1: Wisdom has built her house; she has hewn out her seven pillars.
9.2: She has prepared her food, she has spiced her wine, and she also has set her dining table.
9.3: She has sent out her young women, while calling out from the heights of the city,
9.4: "Let whoever is naïve, turn in here." To anyone lacking sense, she says,
9.5: "Come! Eat my food, and drink the wine that I have mixed.
9.6: Leave your naïve ways, and live. Walk in the path of understanding."
9.7: Whoever corrects a mocker invites only insult, and whoever rebukes the wicked will himself become stained.
9.8: Don't rebuke a mocker or he will hate you. Rebuke a wise person, and he will love you.
9.9: Counsel a wise man, and he will be wiser still; teach a righteous man, and he will add to his learning.
9.10: The fear of the LORD is where wisdom begins, and knowing holiness demonstrates understanding.
9.11: For because of me you will live a long life, and years will be added to your life.
9.12: If you are wise, your wisdom will assist you. If you mock, you alone will be held responsible.
9.13: The foolish woman is loud, undisciplined, and without knowledge.
9.14: She sits at the entrance of her house, on a seat high above the city.
9.15: She calls out to those passing by on the road, who are minding their own business,
9.16: "Whoever is naïve, turn in here!" And to anyone lacking sense, she says,
9.17: "Stolen waters are sweet, and food eaten in secret is delicious."
9.18: But he does not realize that the dead lurk there, and her invited guests wind up in the depths of Sheol.

10.1: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish son grieves his mother.
10.2: Nothing good comes from ill-gotten wealth, but righteousness delivers from death.
10.3: The LORD won't cause the righteous to hunger, but he will reject what the wicked crave.
10.4: Lazy hands bring poverty, but hard-working hands lead to wealth.
10.5: Whoever harvests during summer acts wisely, but the son who sleeps during harvest is disgraceful.
10.6: Blessings come upon the head of the righteous, but the words of the wicked conceal violence.
10.7: The reputation of the righteous leads to blessing, but the name of the wicked will rot.
10.8: The wise person accepts commands, but the chattering fool will be brought down.
10.9: Whoever walks in integrity lives prudently, but whoever perverts his way of life will be exposed.
10.10: Those who wink their eyes are trouble makers, and the mocking fool will be brought down.
10.11: What the righteous say is a flowing fountain, but what the wicked say conceals violence.
10.12: Hatred awakens contention, but love covers all transgressions.
10.13: Wisdom characterizes the speech of the discerning, but the rod is for the backs of those lacking discernment.
10.14: Those who are wise store up knowledge, but when the fool speaks, destruction is near.
10.15: The rich hide within the fortress that is their wealth, but the poor are dismayed due to their poverty.
10.16: Honorable wages lead to life; the salaries of the wicked, to retribution.
10.17: Whoever heeds correction is on the pathway to life, but someone who ignores exhortation goes astray.
10.18: Whoever conceals hatred is a deceitful liar, and whoever spreads slander is a fool.
10.19: Transgression is at work where people talk too much, but anyone who holds his tongue is prudent.
10.20: What the righteous person says is like precious silver; the thoughts of the wicked are compared to small things.
10.21: What the righteous person says nourishes many, but fools die because they lack discerning hearts.
10.22: The blessing of the LORD establishes wealth, and difficulty does not accompany it.
10.23: Just as the fool considers wickedness his joy, so is wisdom to the discerning man.
10.24: What the wicked fears will come about, but the longing of the righteous will be granted.
10.25: When the storm ends, the wicked vanish, but the righteous person is forever firm.
10.26: As vinegar is to the mouth and smoke to the eyes, so is the lazy person to those who send him.
10.27: Fearing the LORD prolongs life, but the wicked will not live long.
10.28: What the righteous hope for brings joy, but the expectation of the wicked dies.
10.29: To the upright, the way of the LORD is a place of safety, but it's a place of ruin to those who practice evil.
10.30: The righteous will never be overthrown, but the wicked will never inhabit the land.
10.31: The words of the righteous overflow with wisdom, but the perverse tongue will be cut out.
10.32: Righteous lips know what is prudent, but the words of the wicked are perverse.

11.1: The LORD hates false scales, but he delights in accurate weights.
11.2: When pride appears, disgrace accompanies it, but humility is present with wisdom.
11.3: The integrity of the righteous guides them, but the hypocrisy of the treacherous destroys them.
11.4: Wealth won't help in the time of judgment, but righteousness will deliver from death.
11.5: The righteousness of the innocent creates a level path, but the wicked fall by their wickedness.
11.6: The righteousness of the upright delivers them, but the treacherous are trapped by their evil desires.
11.7: When a wicked person dies, his hope vanishes; and what he expected from his scheming comes to nothing.
11.8: The righteous person is delivered from trouble; it comes upon the wicked instead.
11.9: By what he says, the godless person can destroy his neighbor, but through knowledge the righteous escape.
11.10: The city rejoices when the righteous prosper, and when the wicked perish there is jubilation.
11.11: Through the blessing of the righteous a city is built up, but what the wicked say tears it down.
11.12: Whoever belittles his neighbor lacks sense, but the discerning man controls his comments.
11.13: Whoever spreads gossip betrays secrets, but the trustworthy person keeps a confidence.
11.14: A nation falls through a lack of guidance, but victory comes through the counsel of many.
